number of helpful: 751 of 824 people (91%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Cry of Fear is a Psychological First Person Shooter Survival Horror game.Cry of Fear is my 2nd favorite game of all time. It only gets beaten by S.T.A.L.K.E.R. I love Cry of Fear so much because of the atmosphere, the sick and twisted horror or it might be because, and I can assure you that,  it is one of the best survival horror games I ever played for not being triple A. The atmosphere is one of the best ever accomplished in a video game as well. Only Silent Hill and Condemned or Amnesia being much higher on the ranking,, but what makes this games environment stand out is the brutal emptiness of the swedish city nightsky, the lonliness, the monsters and the madness playing around simon, the protagonist. It´s depressing, oppressing, evil and obscure, something very unique even if nothing compared to condemned, suffering, in its execution, but a own unique set of art and atmosphere. The story is simple but good even if the execution is not up to par with what you expect from a high quality script. Simon acts really naive and childish sometimes but grows with further developement of the story, establishing a good connection between the player and Simon. Depressed, full of emotional problems and self suppression, having problems of confessing his feelings for his crush, Simon is getting into an car accident, which changes his life forever. If you could throw♥♥♥♥♥♥at someone, everyone would throw it at Simon.I don´t want to spoil to much here so I simply want to say that this games story is mainly about suicidal, homicidal thoughts, depression, anxiety and shizophrenic mental illness. It talks to people with mental issues, as well as it does show mentally sane people at least the realism inside the surrealism of being a ♥♥♥♥ed up individual. As you can see, a topic not everyone likes, that´s why not everyone really liked playing the game for its story, or because the story was not speaking to some/most of the players, or they disliked the gameplay which is a taste on its own. For more look at the gameplay section of this review.Not everyone like me or maybe you went through the same situations and thoughts as Simon. I can feel for him with all of my heart though. Give it a try and see for yourself. Make sure to be open enough for these topics though. You really have to try it out and give it a chance. It´s based on the GoldSrc engine on which also Half Life 1 was running on. Team Psykskallar really made the best out of this old engine and you can clearly see it. Graphics are fantastic for what they can provide engine wise. Horror, Gameplay, Puzzles, etc.:You have a big variety of levels, from the typical subway station to the mental hospital and forest but also parks and sewers, subway maintenace bays, construction sites and apartements, a school, a very nice boat scene and more!You have an inventory system like resident evil. You have to carefully pick and manage your equipment. It´s kept more simple though. Weapon models are excellent, as are their animations and the sound design overall. Close Combat is clunky at the beginning but gets better and very smooth and satisfying after some time, as you figure out that GoldSrc is not good with melee weapons and thus the modder Andreas Rönnberg thought that a Dodge Button or double tap S or W, A or D could be quite useful and you start to adapt. Most people still don´t know that, you can even disable it in the options completely. Some people though will never learn it or like it. It really is just improvised and clunky due to the problems that old engine puts up.Do not worry Mr.Shooter, usually after the apartements, as soon as you get your first gun, that should be after 40 mins, you change the playstyle anyway. From 100% melee to what ever percentage of combatstyles, due to ammo count, you want. You have to create your own technique of slash and dodge to succesfully kill your opponent when once run out of ammo due to ammo scarcity. Dodging is purely accomplished by exercising it. Ammo for guns can be scarce on normal and hard, not so much on easy. Now to the horror. If you played Amnesia or Slender and you felt it was a walk in the park, then this game is nothing for you. It´s between Resident Evil with a touch Silent Hill. It has some cheap jumpscares, good jumpscares, many jumpscares, either unpredictable or very predictable, depending on your experience with game design, level design, and games, especially horror games in general. If you fall into the horrorspiral and you start being scared by this game and a nice haunting paranoia scrawls up your skin, it seems like this game achieved what it wanted to achieve. The Paranoia and meaninglessness of the world in general will hit you. This game is pure shizophrenia and depression in one pill to go.The soundtrack is one of the best in video games history, fitting perfectly to the games environment, characters emotional state and just the mood of the game, making it effective to build tension and depressiong feelings in the right moments. If you are a very emotional or sensitive person, you will love it. If you are a cold brick, better go back and play your casual games or tougher horror games with VR because CoF is really just a nice spooky ride and not a house of horror wanting you to♥♥♥♥♥♥your pants. Those games are horror focused as with this game it uses horror as its style. Some "Puzzles"/Riddles can be frustrating and many parts can be hard to accomplish or are just pure adrenaline kicks (maze). As the maze is easy and requires the typical smart gamer skillset of good memory it can come over as if the game is badly designed or unbalanced. Yes, you have no map... why would you, the maps in this game aren´t that big anyway. Use your brain or go back to elementary school. First time playing it, its hard, but after you solved them, it´s really satisfying and rewarding and you can simply facepalm yourself for your own stupidity. I did at the fuse backtracking. The overall feeling after finishing the game is fantastic. It makes you feel accomplishment. And don´t call Simon an Emo or I come and eat your eyeballs.Endings & Game Length:There are different endings and choices to be made, if I remember correctly, you have two choices which give you 4 main story endings. 1 co-op ending, 1 secret and 1 manhunt campaign ending.The game is about 10 hrs for beginners and 8 for faster people and can be beaten in sub 2,5 hrs by pros or challenge hunters.Conclusion:For me it´s a 10/10. A fair unbiased rating would be a 7/10. It has its problems but how I like to say: Somebody who can´t be patient and endure a few grinding moments, also can´t enjoy the joy of accomplishment and nostalgia.Technical Issues & Contacting Me:If you have technical issues, please go to the CoF Forums, contact me or ask other CoF players for help. We always want to help as much as we possibly can. ^^ This game is heavily modified,  to such a degree, it´s just obvious that it´s having many technical bugs and problems on older or unstable systems. Sometimes it´s a graphical setting and sometimes just the steam client forgetting to download a file, so checking the game files often helps. Please don´t send friend invites just for wanting to play with me. You can add me anyways but keep in mind I won´t play it with you. ^^ I played the game long enough since its 2012 release. ^^ I got the whole cake already. On the forum you can ask others though. I´ve beaten every possible story and the co-op easily 5 to 8 times, gimme a break please :/Official Forum and Technical Support[www.cry-of-fear.com]Fun Fact: I think I noticed something. Don´t the trash bins in the game look hella lot like the official Team Psykskallar logo? :]

content:
Posted: October 4, 2014
Have you ever wanted to have your pants filled up with your own poo?  Now you can, for free!Before I start I would like to state that this is MY OPINION and what I think of this game.Cry of fear is a Psychological First Person Shooter Survival Horror and is one of the SCARIEST games I have ever played! It isn't one of your average cheesey horror games. Cry of fear is a game where you never know what to expect around the corner.  It could be a chainsaw maniac that wants to chop off your head or a mental deranged child wanting to kill you.  Even though sometimes the enemies get repeated in some sections there are always fresh jumpscares that make up for it.The Good/The BadGood Scary unlike other horror games Unpredictable The game is around 8 hours long (plenty of jumpscares!) It's got co-op so you can crap yourself with your friends Free!Bad Outdated graphics Sometimes buggy (not often, very rare) Some sections of the game are unforgiving (lots of enemies, not much ammo) Co-op sometimes doesn't work (very good when it does)VerdictSounds 8/10Graphics 5/10 (uses half life 1 engine)Gameplay 8/10Atmosphere 10/10Overall Score           9/10"Fantastic, Frightening          and Free"Cry of Fear is a highly recomended game for anyone who likes a truly scary game and a bit of a challenge as well.  It's free, so what are you waiting for? Get Cry of Fear NOW!==========Update=============From what I know multiplayer doesnt work in Australia.  May work in other countries.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2014
 Pros and Cons here we go! Woot Woot!  What you'll love... - The Story... It's really Enjoyable and Depressing (hey, it's a horror game) at the same time!- The Gameplay... Excluding the confusing inventory, the gameplay is awesome! Survival Horror at it's best!- The Soundtrack... One word: BEATIFUL! If you can, buy it! Support the devs and listen to this relaxing/scary/awesome soundtrack! (actually, there are 2 soundtracks!)- The Co-Op... Yeah, i guess it's broken and you need to port forward or use Hamatchi, but when you actually get to play it, it's AWESOME!- The Visuals... It's using a 1998's engine, but looks good by today's standards too! Psykskallar milked everything out of the GoldSource engine! What you'll hate... - Some Cheap Jumpscares only scary once or twice...- Some low res Textures and graphical bugs (you won't notice them if you aren't trying to find them on purpose, hopefully)- Difficulty curves, ya know... bosses and Sawrunner...- Forgetting not to waste ammo (you lose unspent bullets if you reload with a non-empty magazine*)- And of course... having to wash your underwear after playing this amazing Survival Horror game which will not only require you to change underwear, but sleep with the lights on for the next few days!- Skandi007 Survival Horror VeteranIf this was a REVIEW (oh wait, it is) i'd give this game a 9/10, i really love it...There is some room for improvement... but i can live with that... :)

content:
Posted: October 23, 2014
												Likes:I like that it had a different campaign for solo and multiplayer. Also that the multiplayer version was a continue of the first version. I LOVE that there was a survival mode. I liked that there were parts that weren't even meant to scare the player, yet they did. I like how the game had a good storyline. I also love that it was free! The game even ran well (most of the time) on my bad laptop! The game had some scary parts, but was not overly-abusive about the jumpscares and other scary stuff...Dislikes:I wish there was a create-your-own survival mode, even though I can understand that is back-breakingly hard to do... I at least wish the creator would've put more effort into the survival mode, making it easier in some way or less repetitive. The solo and multiplayer campaigns were VERY fun! However, there were some parts that annoyed me half to death. Some of the jump puzzles, the enemies that one shot you (sometimes), and least importantly... the enemy movement...I'm currently STUCK on the first part of chapter six with an annoying jump-puzzle... It's annoying! I also wish there was an item, or something, that would give you more inventory space. Overall:The game was VERY good! There were some parts that were annoying and some things I wish existed, but with what the game has, it's GREAT!!! I give it 4.25 golden stars that don't exist anywhere, but my mind, but that counts for something ;) -P.S. I want more...

number of helpful: 114 of 124 people (92%) found this review helpful10 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 16, 2014
												Cry of Fear is simply the best Half-Life mod I have ever played, with the exception of Counter-Strike back in the day. This game shouldn't even be classified as a mod in my opinion. The engine has been utilized so well that there is little resemblence to the look of Half-Life.Story:The story of Cry of Fear is worth experiencing for sure. I like the mystery aspects to the story and your character's journey in figuring out what's going on. There are many WTF moments, which I like in survival horror games. Plus, there are mutliple endings, so the replay value is decent. I don't want to give anything away, so you willl have to check it out yourself. Definitely plays with the mind and is more of a psychological horror thriller than a straight up jump scare horror game, which in my opinion makes for a much more interesting experience.Gameplay:This game truly is survival horror and the designers understand how to make the player feel like every resource is valuable. Similar to games like the early Bioharzard (Resident Evil) or Silent Hill games, items like firearms, ammunition, light sources, health, etc. all become scarce quickly if not rationed correctly and you always feel relieved to find more. There are times where I decided to sprint past enemies instead of trying to take them out since I didn't have enough ammunition or they were heavy in numbers. Speaking of enemies, there is a decent variety to them and they are creepy as hell. The animations make them very disturbing, and the sound effects that belong to each of them unnerve your senses. As for the objectives, they are usually pretty simple for the most part. There is a lot of back tracking, but it does make sense within the story, so it didn't really become annoying. There were some areas where I got confused on where to go, but to me, this helps the experience more than hindering it. I don't always want to be told where to go or what to do so directly. Survival horror games should make you think for yourself. Most games lack this aspect. The firearms feel much more realistic  than most games. They have some serious recoil and the accuracy is fairly similar to the real thing, at least from my limited experience.Graphics:The game is very well polished for being built on such an old engine compared to the new ones. There are many details on the characters and enemies that bring out their personalities or lack thereof. Since this is a FPS with third person cutscenes mostly, the hands and weapons look very realistic. Very good details, especially on the firearms. The animations are done very well and the designers really didn't try to shortcut anything. Lighting, color, post processing, water, textures, etc. were all done very well, especially for a free game. The only gripe I feel anyone can make is only because of how old the engine is for the game, so obviously the polygon count isn't nearly as high as modern games. The settings are very detailed and make you feel like you are there in Sweden, which is where the game takes place. You are mostly in an urban environment, cautiously going through the streets, alleys, sewers, parks, buildings, etc. However, there are some other settings such as the forest and suburban areas.Overall:This game has accomplished everything it set out to do in my opinion. The sound design and music compliment the harsh disturbing atmosphere and really creeps you out, especially when you don't know what's around the next corner. The graphics are great for the resources used, the gameplay is true survival horror, and it's FREE!!! So, sit back, turn the lights off, turn up the volume, have a weapon near you along with a change of pants if need be, and enjoy this game. I would pay money to play this game, let's leave it at that.My review is based on playing the single player only. I did not play through any other game mode. There is a co-op mode and a survivor mode as well, adding some more replay value.5/5

Posted: May 28, 2014
												Cry of fear is not for everyone, but it shows some people some problems with our world today. Lonely, depressed, suicidal, and angry. These are only some words to explain Simon, the main character. The game allows you to play as this run down man trying to find hope, answers, love. Loneliness has turned this man into something he's not, loneliness changes lives. For everyone who thinks popularity will make you cool, gtfo. You help ruin lives, destroy love, and kill others. You bully the kids who you think are "lame". Next thing you know, they kill themselves, all because you want to be popular. This game can change the way you look at the world today. You will feel horrible, sad, angry. This game shows us what bullying, and loneliness can do to people. If you just think popularity will get you somewhere in life, you won't like what you did when your dead. Simon is what many people feel like. Team Psykskallar hits this dead on. They show what loneliness can do to people. 10/10

content:
Posted: March 21, 2015
												I remember waiting for the mod to come out for months at a time. It just looked like it was going to be the greatest thing ever. An atmospheric survival horror that let you fight back, just like Silent Hill or Resident Evil. Except this one is in the first person! At the time, I thought it was going to be one of the greatest single player mods ever. And that's exactly what we got.Graphically, this game goes beyong what the GoldSrc engine seemed to be capable of. The use of filters and high poly models, various graphical effects and I was blown out of my seat when I saw that water. This certainly isn't a bad looking game, even from a design standpoint. Even though the game is dark and dreary, the locations really felt like how they were supposed to. It really felt like I was wandering the city streets, or getting lost in the forest at night, or breaking into abandoned buildings. It was a genuine feeling that most games don't have today even with their emphasis on detail.The gameplay wasn't god awful but it still made you feel hindered. You had to take your time aiming and be careful with your shots to conserve ammo. Sometimes you'd have to abandon certain weapons because you couldn't carry all of them including the key items, but there was that chance you could back track and pick up that weapon later. What I liked the most is that the use of things such as sprinting and using the sights on your guns fit in with the game well. Sure, it slowed down the game but regarding your ammo, that felt necessary. The enemies are great, too. Each with their own unique set of skills and abilities as well as their macabre designs. It fits in with the game's abandoned otherworldly atmosphere perfectly.The game isn't even that short, either. In fact, it's pretty lengthy for a mod and rivals some AAA titles in terms of length and content. as you can see from my hours, it took me a while to beat this game because I felt like I needed to take my time with it. Having to go back and get weapons, dying to things I wasn't familiar with, struggling with puzzles, it felt like a game that would have stood its ground against the likes of the survival horror greats. The story is strange and, for some reason, it's logical as to why everything's so messed up.You even have a bunch of stuff to unlock. It's mainly hoodies, but it's still something you can strive for in your multiple playthroughs, especially if you're looking to challenge yourself on the harder difficulties. It has multiplayer too, which is done in such a way that acts as a sequel. It does re-use the maps so that's a bit disappointing. The game itself is so good that it warrants a second playthrough just to experience the game again. Oh, and mods. There's mods for this game and they're not that bad either.After it's all said and done, I take a look at the game's development on ModDB and I can't help but think; This game was the last hurrah for GoldSrc mods. There hasn't been a GoldSrc mod to come out in recent years that had anywhere near the amount of hype this game had. It was played to death by let's players, it was critically acclaimed by the community, it was a beautiful thing to come out of this veteran mod team, being that these are the same guys who also made Afraid of Mosters, another brilliant GoldSrc mod. These are memories that I'm most likely not going to have again, anticipating for this mod as if no other game in the world mattered and the conversations that would ensue between my friends as we played it through on the day of its release made the experience all the more memorable. That was a little over three years ago, but the memories are still fresh in my mind.tl;dr, PLAY THIS GAME NOW.

												Great game with a lot of problems. It's basically just elements from other survival horror games all rolled into one, but it doesn't really mix them all seamlessly. Also the main portion of the game is a fetch quest where you're going back and forth between large areas looking for a couple of items.Inventory management is very strict as well so you often have to drop very useful items just to keep the game progressing. I also wonder if the voice acting is bad on purpose?As a horror game it excels. Atmosphere, sound, design, everything looks and plays great but it's just very unfufilled in terms of gameplay. This is a free mod developed by a small team so you've got to give it credit for that, but just don't believe all the hype, this is a game with a lot of issues.Full Video Review:

												Swedish FPS Horror at its finest. Better than most AAA horror games nowadays.If you liked this, you should also consider trying Afraid of Monsters: Director's Cut, a Half-Life mod on Moddb, made by the same guy.Cry of Fear is kind of like Afraid of Monsters, except slower paced, less paranormal stuff, has an inventory and dual wielding system, etc. As well as most notably, a new coat of paint on the GoldSource engine, so the visuals are pretty slick this time around.So you wake up in an alley way, probably from being wasted, or maybe someone mugged you and punched your lights out, gotta find a way home.You soon find out that there is hammer wielding maniacs and other... things.. running about and wreaking havoc on your face.Did the local insane asylum break loose? Was an evil portal opened up by the local madman? Could I possibly pull out any more random excuses out of my♥♥♥♥♥to make this review any more mediocre?Well you'll just have to play the damn game to find out!8/10, would get spooked and run low on memory and crash again.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
												Cry of Fear is a mixed bag. The game and pretty much everything about it is fantastic, with one glaring flaw: the drawbacks of using an engine as old as GldSource with so many modifications is that this game will crash. A lot.This wouldn't be such an issue if you weren't relying on savepoints, but *SPOILERS AHEAD* I got stuck in the train tunnels where you have to use the flares because it managed to crash three times in a row at about the point where you get to the doctor. At that point I gave up. But if it says anything, it is good enough I'm likely going to try to get it to work tomorrow. If you are somebody who despises any game with the potential of losing progress due to poor mechanics, then maybe you should pass this up.Other than the stability issues, this is a superb game and it scared me quite a few times. I loved the inventory system, if I had one complaint about it, keys shouldn't count as items. I know it may be a 'drop a weapon so you can progress' kind of game at times, but the only effect taking up my inventory with keys has is making me backtrack for the sake of getting back certain weapons I had to drop to pick up some keys.The music provided the perfect tone for every environment you can imagine, and was so good that it could create effective tension even in a room that is completely empty except for the player. I had a very nice time with this one, one of my all time favorite horrors in general. I'd recommend any fan of the genre pick this up if you have the time to get it working properly._____EDIT: Got it to work and have beaten the game twice. The story and visual beauty is so compelling that I'd recommend you continue playing even if you do experience frequent crashes. Final Score:9.5/10

number of helpful: 44 of 45 people (98%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 23, 2016
												It's a shame modern games don't really have the kind of modding scenes older FPSes did. The Half-life games in particular spawned some quality mods and conversions across quite a few genres, horror included. Cry of Fear is just such a project, with so much work put in that it's barely recognizable as a Half-life mod save for the familiar movement mechanics. And while it may have some rough edges, you might be surprised how spooky this one can get.You play Simon, a hoodied inhabitant of Stockholm, on his way home for the night. Through a mysterious and sudden event, he finds himself roaming deserted streets and buildings while assailed by nightmarish figures. Using the few meager weapons you find, you'll have to battle through the countless monsters to reach whatever lies at the end of your journey.In contrast with most first-person shooters, Cry of Fear has you fighting small handfuls of enemies with a very limited arsenal. During the first hour of the game, you'll have naught but a pocket knife and a weak pistol to guide you through. It's enough to overcome the mostly melee-focused monsters in your way, especially since you tend to encounter them one at a time. There's also a stamina bar used for dodging that's going to get a lot of use, because you're soon going to find there's only one good way to fight monsters in the cramped quarters of the game.I give Cry of Fear credit for crafting environments that look very much like real places, but this is one of those times where realism eats into the actual fun. Real-world alleys and hallways are VERY narrow, cutting off a lot of tactical options. Most of your encounters are going to be in tight hallways where you can't get around or past your foe. This leaves you doing the old duck in, stab, duck out shuffle for virtually every creature you come across. It's not quite as easy as it sounds but it can get very tedious very quickly.Despite the flat combat, the inhabitants of the game do a fine job of spooking you. There's a wide variety of horrors to battle, from eye-gouged murderers to spike-armed puppets and all the way to flying hospital bed monsters. They'll often come screaming at you from down a dark hallway or behind a door they just smashed down, and I had a few good jolts from them including the ones I kinda knew were coming. Cry of Fear's horror is very shock-centric, with herky-jerky creatures barreling out of the shadows and disembodied heads screaming at you in the cutscenes.It's not just monster mashing, either. You'll come across a number of puzzles, each one more grounded than hunting crests and some of them actually being pretty clever setups, like hacking a PC cafe terminal for a padlock code. There are also keys, health syringes, and other important items to collect and keep in your mostly unnecessary inventory screen. This screen lets you assign items to your three paltry hotkeys and use things like keys on doors, but honestly the game would flow a lot better without it. The game would also flow better with less backtracking in some of the larger levels, like the nigh-endless apartment complex. I also have gripes with the monsters sometimes glitching out and doing no damage, and the bosses being pretty underwhelming and a bit sloggy.Honestly though, I'm prepared to forgive all that for the excellent atmosphere and craftsmanship that went into this game. What you're getting is like a looser, less-polished Condemned, right down to the melee focus and decrepit setting. The dark, cramped, detailed levels establish a very grimy, oppressive feel that lends terror to the already freaky enemies. The soundtrack takes cues from Silent Hill in the best ways, going for grinding, pounding songs and effects when the action peaks. It's a long, long game as well, so if you're digging the grunge feel and stabby combat, there'll be plenty of it, and that's not even touching the custom story and co-op support. Cry of Fear trips on a few fronts but still clears the bar for an excellent horror game, thanks to some choice atmosphere and amount of content.

content:
Posted: November 16, 2014
												        This game, like many other games, has gameplay. You can move, you can look around, and occasionally, fire a gun. It has graphics. It has lighting effects. It has a decent color pallet. It is also free to play, so you can't go wrong. It has a story unlike any other. It has enemies to combat. It also has allies that can help you on your quest. Unlike a lot of games nowadays, it has varied, thematic, set pieces. Don't let the title fool you, you won't be crying in fear, you will be crying about how amazing of an experience you've had, absolutely free, so you can save the money for passover. The movement is pretty dynamic. If you walk into a hard surface, you will stop. No longer will you have that lingering feeling that at any moment, you will fall through the floor. Oh, I forgot to mention that this game has a very engaging, and cinematic co-op experience. Each moment in co-op is unlike any other before it. You and your friends will experience a truly heart-wrenching, claustrophobic, gut-pounding, bowel movement-inducing, spoop filled catastrophe. Never has there been a more immersive co-op experience. The indie aspect truly shines throughout the many epic, magnificent, unanimous, diverse, open world realms. The only downside, and I truly regret to have to report on this, is the complete lack of an in depth character customization. Without a feature as crucial as character customization, I FEAR that this game will be overlooked by many. I CRY at the very thought that this game will go unnoticed. It is with all of my heart, that I recommend this game to everyone who enjoys a fast paced, adrenaline fueled, ride into the mind of the developers. Brace yourself for the emotional rollercoaster, and try not to CRY when you reach the end.

content:
Posted: June 6, 2016
												Cry of Fear is a well executed Half Life 1 mod, focusing on first person survival horror. You play in the shoes of the flawed protagonist named Simon after a life changing accident, following the main characters struggles with Anxiety and Depression. The game itself is very well executed for a free to play game, although graphically it looks outdated, this does not draw away from the overall ambience and horrific designs of many of the monster filled throughout the game. All mechanics feel swift and responsive, including the combat mechanics.   Also, many different game modes are available to play, including doctor mode and nightmare mode! There is also a coop feature, which lets you immerse in the fear together as a different set of characters. In conclusion, Cry of Fear was a very entertaining and immersive gaming experience with a ton of replayability. If you are a fan of the Silent Hill series, I would extremely encourage you to try this game out if you have not already! As a free to play game, you have nothing to lose and I assure you it will be worth the time to download!

content:
Posted: August 3, 2013
												Cry of Fear is a psychological single-player and co-op horror. You play as a young man, Simon, desperately searching for answers in the cold Scandinavian night, finding his way through the city as he slowly descends into madness.The single player campaign claims to take about eight hours time.There is also another secret campaign after beating the first, then a completely separate co-op campaign, and multiple custom campaigns along with a custom campaign and map creator that is intuitive and easy to use.The gameplay is like most survival horror games. You do have a backpack and your pockets but you cannot carry everything, forcing you to make sacrifices on what you want to carry and what you need to carry.Cry of Fear's atmosphere is great, the dark corridors, the creepy forests to a tight packed school, the environments are varied and have a great way of getting you in the mood and into the game. Another aspect of the atmosphere in sound, Cry of Fear has a wonderful soundtrack with scary, dark tracks and beautiful melodies.Cry of Fear was a Half-Life 1 mod that turned into a full free game. I  recommend it to everybody who loves horror games. You will not get anything better for free.Sounds 9/10Graphics 7/10Gameplay 8/10Atmosphere 10/10If you liked my review, please feel free to follow me and/or my curator group:http://steamcommunity.com/id/Ov3RT4K3R/myworkshopfiles/?section=guideshttp://steamcommunity.com/groups/orcollective#curationAlso feel free to check out my YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC83DYCmrWfl9ttrhX54jmWA

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
												Let me just say I've never played Half-Life, and knowing Cry of Fear started as a mod of that game makes me very intrigued to try it out, being as Cry of Fear is one of my favorite games on Steam. I have never been so unsettled and on the edge of my seat while playing a video game before in my life. I have played all the Silent Hill games, Siren Blood Curse etc. but none of those games made me feel so happily full of dread as this game. I enjoy being frightened and shocked; to me it's the best part of being alive. I don't know where to start because in my opinion there are so many positive things I can say about this game. For starters, it makes me happy/sad that I finally got to play a protagonist that so openly displays himself as a "cutter". I have a huge amount of respect for the Devs for keeping it in the game. I'm not saying I approve of self-mutilation, on the contrary I am strongly against it, but it is a real thing that many people go through and for the Devs to shed light on this sensitive subject is very brave of them. Certain aspects of the game are challenging, for example: escaping the falling subway. But for me thats what makes it that much more rewarding and enjoyable. the game is very dark and disturbing, so if you are scared of being chased by a lunatic with a chainsaw, claustrophobic or "Facebook", I would think twice before trying this game. The dark matter in the game: self-mutilation, suicide and depression, are present throughout most of the game. The story is very well done, and I appreciate the fact that there are multiple endings (similar to Silent Hill games), which gives some replay value. Along with the extra unlockable content, which includes weapons and alternate clothing options. I've never tried out the co-op or Manhunt mode so I cannot give my opinion on that part of the game. The custom campaigns are a nice add on as well, but I would suggest waiting until you've played the campaign all the way through before playing them to fully appreciate and understand them.

content:
Posted: May 24, 2016
Product received for free
												Cry of Fear is an outstanding game, giving insight into the mind of a depressed teenager riddled with anxiety. For someone who is unfamiliar to these sorts of conditions this game may come off slightly hyperrealistic and only distorted for the horror aspect of the game, but that is not the case. Like a lot of other people, the main character's monsters all represent something he deals with in the real world, whether that being personal relationships, or his anger towards the world in the first place. Not only is the story solid, but the game play is easy to follow, yes there are times you must go back through an area you've already seen, but in doing so you begin to see how our main character sees everything as repetitive. The whole game is about the main character and what these depressing thoughts and anxiety riddled interations play a part in his life and what they do to him mentally. Cry of Fear is truley a step up from Team Psykskallar's orginal title 'Afraid of Monsters' not only in the horror aspect of the game, but story wise as well. Really hoping to see more titles from them soon.

number of helpful: 22 of 25 people (88%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												I'll start by saying, if you're a horror fan you have no reason not to at least try this game. Its free and has a gripping and quite lengthy story driven campaign. Thats not to mention it also has a seperate coop campaign and even tools to make your own custom campaigns.You follow a teen called Simon, a deeply troubled soul who for some reason gets caught up in a car accident. Upon his awake, he realises he's been left abondoned in unfamiliar territory only equipped with his mobile phone and pocket knife. Many questions have now been raised; How and why is he is here? How he did get away unscathed? Who and what are these shadowly figures that keep appearing around each new corner?The game pretty much plays like any other survival horror game. You control SImon from first person view and move from A to B collecting various items and solved puzzles along with way. The atmosphere here is perfect and is only made better with the chilling soundtrack. Even though it can look a little dated now (which is probably down to this being a Half-Life 1, Source Gold engine mod to be fair), this seems to only help with the creepy factor. I do get a sense that this game was heavily influenced by the Silent Hill series due to the settings and surreal nature of the gameplay but again this is by no means a bad thing. It contains a plater of jump scares, some cheap and some less so but these are all well mixed with some very unique experiences. Thats not to say the game doesnt have its problems. Some of the combat can be far too frequent at times giving it a repetitive feel. The maze-like map design can get confusing causing you re-tread many a room unnecessarily. Also the game does have tech and bug issues. I've had a number of crashes and random glitches but these were thankfully few and far between.Overall, I throughly enjoyed this and it has some excellent work on show. Its only a shame these guys wont get at least something in return for this. Highly recommended.

number of helpful: 22 of 25 people (88%) found this review helpful34 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 28, 2016
												I play 30 minutes of Cry of FearThen I stop.There's a free game called "Virdi" that is supposed to be great at relaxing your nerves, so I play that for a bit.It's a virtual flower garden. I play Virdi. I water my succulents. I draw sketches of my succulents.Then I play Cry of Fear again for another 30 minutes.I go back to my succulents. I play another 15 minutes of Cry of Fear, but immediately stop when I hear the Sawrunner.I go back to my succulents. I can still hear the SawrunnerI water my Echeverria "Lola"I can still hear the SawrunnerI prune some weeds from my pot, that I have dubbed "The Dankest Pot."I can see Sophie's bloody, strewn body on the pavement.I plant my new Lithops Optica Rubras.Their blood-red tinge makes me think of the Human Flowers that impale Simon and drag his corpse to be amalgamated in their gore.The sketches of my succulents are now tainted with imagery of jagged knives and weeping women. They were my only respite from the hell that is Simon's mind. Cry of Fear still managed to poison my Garden.10/10 would have my mind permanently corrupted for all of eternity again.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2016
												Truly one of the best horror games I ever played. That is, as soon as I got it to run properly. It would often spaz out after playing an hour or so, but I noticed that if I went into the options menu and changed the resolution every now and again (so that all textures etc. got reloaded) the game ran perfectly. Now, the gameplay:A lot of modern horror games seem to think that there is nothing scarier than not being able to defend yourself. While that is indeed a scary thought (and works wonders in Outlast), knowing that you can indeed effectively defend yourself in Cry of Fear can have an inverted effect. You and only you are responsible for your survival. Success depends largely on your capability to react properly and not give in to fear. If you're looking for a a really really good scary game that has a very disturbing and grim tone, this is the game for you. Try not to get depressed while playing it.The one downside to this is the voice acting. The Swedish accent doesn't bother me, it's just that the voice acting doesn't sound like the actors meant it.

number of helpful: 16 of 16 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 1, 2016
												Cry of Fear is a psychological horror FPS set in the Scandinavian Stockholm, playing as Simon, who got dangerously depressed after a car accident that costed the functionality of his legs. You don't actually play as Simon in person, but as the Simon in his own head, making every obstacle, every horrifying monster and every environmental obstruction a reflection to his real-life depression, which makes this game so different from the rest.The game is built in the Half Life engine and originally started in Greenlight, but has made its way on Steam. Rightfully.PROS:+ Unique type of gameplay/story with different choices and endings+ Long gameplay (easily 7-8 hours)+ Terrifyingly scary + Free to play+ Touching story+ Many unlockable weapons and items+ You don't need Half Life or its engine to run itCONS:- Can trigger actual depression if you're susceptible- Some puzzles can take a good while to figure out- Several bugs/audio/visual problemsIgnore the cons, honestly. Play this game. It's not just a game, it's an experience that leaves its mark on you.Note: this game isn't easy!My rating: 10/10 (and yes, I mean that in all honesty)

number of helpful: 16 of 16 people (100%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 6, 2016
												Hello everyone.First of all, sorry for grammatical mistakes, English is not my mothertongue.But still, I want to recommend this game to everyone who likes intelligent and immersive single player games. Cry of Fear is a First-person-shooter, which focusses on Story, Storytelling and Atmosphere, instead of gameplay and bombastic graphics. Nevertheless, the game has some gripping shooting meachanics that work quite well due to the Source-Engine, on which it is based. Same goes for the Graphics. It may not be up-to-date, but the game still has good lighing effects and an overall round view. Plus, it never falls beyond 60 frames. But, as I mentioned, the core of the game is the story. The protagonist is young Simon, who wanderes around a desolated town after being hit by a car. In there, you will find some creepy characters and terrifying monsters. And I literally mean terrifying. They often remind me of Silent Hill, for them to be strangely deformed and tortured looking human beings. It is simply hard to watch them, for you can think of the pain these creatures probadly suffer from. While discovering the city, the player finds out more about Simon's past and sees some strange visions. Later, even reality itself will twist and change to drive you mad. This game is full of cruel, but somehow beautiful madness and creativity and confronts you with some deep frights and things that make you uncomfortable, like pedophilia, suicide, anger and depression. Also the plot twist at the end of the game will hit you hard. Finally, one can say that Cry of Fear is an absolute Gem among the Free2Play games. It is deep, terrifying, adult and intelligent. If you feel strong enough to play it and to discover the depressing story, have fun...Fot I don't want to sound like a mindless fanboy, here is some critizism as well:1. There is some backtracking that might annoy you.2. The game is not always fair, ammo and healing items are unfairly rare.3. The underwater section, which exists for some reason, is incredibly frustrating.4. There are, like in Half Life, some Jump n' Run sections, which are also incredibly frustrating.

number of helpful: 16 of 18 people (89%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7, 2014
												I've entirely redone this review on the 26/10/16. This review will contain minor spoilers.This game is certainly one of the best - if not the best (horror) game I've ever played in my life, and I've played a lot. I've played the campaign and every single custom campaign on nightmare difficulty and received all unlockables (except the donator one, shame on me really). Call me biased but this game seems to be up to par with AAA games despite of it being a mod for Half Life 1.The entire game is set in a mostly realistic and believable scenario (speaking about the proper campaign here) which seems to be Stockholm, in Sweden, though the world tends to have its horror-based twists here and there. The story itself revolves around the way Simon got into a car accident and hasn't been able to deal with his depression and anxiety. But Simon isn't alone - what's with the strange doctor? The guy that you seem to follow throughout the entire game and yet refuses to make a hold for Simon. What's with the girl, Sophie, that Simon goes to the same school with and that was the only person that he seemed to get along with and take care of him and he clearly is in love with? Why do they appear in the game and what's the matter with them? Why are you the way you are and view yourself as this mentally broken individual? Why is Simon trapped inside his own nightmare, fueled by his depressions and fears?I'm baffled by how much effort the developers put into something that is "merely" a Half Life 1 mod. Sure, the graphics are very outdated but by no means are they bad for what they're meant to do. Enemies look gruesome and dangerous, the places look believable (and really realistic for a video game depiction of Stockholm) and it's blatant that the developers put a lot of thought into the way they make enemies look because every, really every single enemy reflects a part of Simon's life/depression/anxiety. Guns are really good looking and they feel satisfying to use. When it gets to sound design though -  it's up to par with the big names and AAA studios. The game generally plays smooth and has a lot of action to it while also having a fair amount of puzzles which all seem to be very plain (carry item x to place y, find x to go to y). Backtracking doesn't happen too often for it to get obnoxious either.The game comes with a dozen of unlockables, custom campaigns and difficulty modes so there should be something for everyone (and the custom campaigns are mostly really good too!). I can proudly say I don't regret my time spent on this game whatsoever.

content:
Posted: January 30, 2015
												Cry of Fear was an amazing experience for me and one of the best HL1 mod I've ever played. It feels more like a standalone game than a mod. It has some bugs here and there but they are not game breaking. The inventar system is very nice and reminds me of the RE inventar. The monster are so ♥♥♥♥ing crazy and different, actually I had more wtf moments from Cry of Fear than from the Silent Hill series. All the custom animations, sounds and cut scenes makes this mod really unique and special.As I playing further and further I can see how much love they put into this piece of work. The replayability is pretty high on Cry of Fear since it has 6 different endings on singleplayer mode and it will unlock secret files plus items after each ending. ( The devs comments are very interesting too! Especially from "ruMpel" lol) Players who only want to enjoy the co-op mode will be a little disappointed here. You can't save your game in this mode nor going back to the previous map unlike in singleplayer where all the maps act as one big section. You will also need a network tool like hamachi in order to connect to your buddies server and sometimes you will be disconnected due to some bugs but nonetheless it is really fun to play the co-op mode with your friends :)Well, this game is pretty sick and disturbing sometimes... don't play it if you are under depression or a scaredy cat :D

content:
Posted: February 14
												This is classic survival horror.  Play on easy, unless you are very familiar with the genre, then play on normal or maybe hard.  Think classic Resident Evil/Silent Hill.  You could end up restarting the game, if you perform poorly enough.It boasts a lot of content: the main campaign, about 6-8 hours, although 2.5 hours is achievable.  There's a 'Hunk' campaign, similar to RE2, after the main campaign where you run a gauntlet with no saves or anything.  There are many unlockables, like infinite ammo famas, camera that freezes everything.  There are also fan-made custom campaigns which can be played in any order, at any time.  Finally, there is a coop campaign.There are 5 different endings you can get, depending on the choices you make.

												Cry of Fear has always seemed to me like an old abandoned playground. You would come there as a child, apprehensively but relentlessly. A place with rusty slides and naked trees around it. First, you're there out of curiosity, trying to overcome your fear. But then the place draws you with its unique atmosphere and memories that it bears. Simon's experience becomes your own depression sweetened by transcendental ambient soundtracks. It's so much like one of your nightmares that you dwell on after a long unsound sleep.If you are born with congenial depression or have a chronic existantial crisis, this will be a nice supplementation to your splendid sufferings.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2015
												I played this game on my old steam account back in the day. This game is one of those gems that define real survival horror. You'll probably need to go shopping for new pants after you're done with this game, assuming you'll have the balls to finish it all the way to the end. This game is very well made. The story is very engaging and the suspense and horror factor in this game is nothing to joke about. The graphics may be outdated by today's gaming standards, but give this game a try and you will not regret picking it up and adding it to your gaming library. In fact, this beats out most survival and horror games on steam...and this one is free! I would have gladly paid for this game for its full price without the need of a steam sale when I first discovered it. It was a godsend that the developer of this game decided to make it free. To show my support for this game, I shall list down an honest review of what I believe the game has made me experience.PROS:- For a game that was based on the old Half-Life engine, it is very well made and polished.- The horror factor in this game is unquestionable. You like getting your pants soiled constantly? Play this game.- The story is quite engaging and is a realistic take on people who suffer from the particular illness the protagonist is going through.- Realistic atmosphere and creepy environment adds to the horror factor of the game.- Classic game, one that will keep you on the edge of your seats the whole time.- Ever played Silent Hill? This game is pretty much on par with it.- This game has the most disturbing and creepy looking enemies you will face.- Online co-op.CONS:- There are some areas in the game that are VERY dark by design, even with the flashlight. You might wanna boost your brightness settings a little bit.- Controls may feel a little clunky at first, but overtime, you'll get used to it and it will seem more fluid as the game progresses.- PewDiePie once did a LP of this game. I rest my case.- The save system and inventory is a little bit troublesome to navigate through and get used to, but like the others, you will get used to it as you progress more with the game.I love horror games even though sometimes I don't have the balls to play them. I'll give this game a solid 9/10. I highly recommend it for both horror casuals and veterans alike.

TO all those who cannot play in 1366 * 768Step 1 : Go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Cry of Fear and open a new NOTEPAD FILEStep2 : Type the following exactly:                              -h 1366 -w 768 -novid -window -noborderStep 3 : Save the file as "userconfig.cfg" (EXACTLY THE SAME NAME)  make sure 'all files' is selected under save as instead of .txt fileStep 4 : Now launch the game.uncheck all the check boxes in the launcher

content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
												I simply love this game. ♥ I loved the story. It's a FPS, you can use a lot of weapons and you need your cellphone to illuminate your way.It's a game full of psychological horror, mystery and action. You must solve some puzzles to continue playing, and you need to be a good player if you want to beat all the creepy monsters and to grab all the weapons. It's awesome how everything has a meaning, each monster, every situation, all the scenery. I loved the end, all makes sense when you finish the game.  The ending depends on the decisions you make throughout the game.The bosses are epic and very originals, its a challenge to defeat them.The only downside to the game are the graphics (And I'm not sure If I have to count this as a bad point) and the technical issues (it crashes a lot or get some bugs) but if you can beat the bosses, I'm pretty sure than you can beat the technical issues.9.5/10 ♥

number of helpful: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 18, 2016
												Absolutely amazing game/mod.I really appreciate how it does go for unsettling tone and atmosphere, more so than cheap and lazy jumpscares. Now, don't get me wrong, there ARE indeed jumpscares here and there, but they don't overboard with it.I especially appreciate how the game does bring and raise awareness for (clinical) depression, suicide, PTSD, paranoia, and possibly schizophrenia.The game has plenty of collectables and secrets that'll keep you hooked and wishing for more.And hey, it's by the same dudes who made Afraid of Monsters. Another equally great HL1 mod.Pros:-Great atmosphere-Amazing soundtrack (can't stress amazing enough)-Twisted and creative monsters (and holy ♥♥♥♥, did they leave a mental scar...)-Horrific and mental scarring audio design-Good, and fair challenge (may vary depending on difficulty and player skill)-Collectables to keep you coming back-Brings awareness to real world mental issues-Jumpscares are present, but time and pace themselves really well-Balanced and fair weaponry (not counting collectables)-Plenty of AoM referneces-Your choices impact the ending!-Boss battles are fun and tenseCons:-Can be really unforgiving (looking at you, S-Rank Nightmare mode... took me ages to get Simon's Book)-Story/endings can actually have a negative impact on the player's emotions-Platforming is a bit clunky and stiff, sometimes unresponsive-Story could have done a better job on such a touchy and sensitive topic-Too much back tracking, feels lazy instead of offering more variety-Game stability is a bit iffy at times-Too much equivocation, not enough information (show, don't tell)-Objective(s) isn't clear most of the time (often found myself consulting a walkthrough)-Reoccuring, almost invulnerable enemy, the Sawrunner -- adds unnecessary tension7/10Great game, fairly polished, very rememberable, could use some work in game design, story telling and difficulty.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
												*** UPDATED ***Cry of Fear is an interesting game not because of how it's done, but the fact that it's the only true survival-horror title we'll ever get in maybe a decade or so.The team that made this game also made the Afraid of Monsters mod for Half-Life, which some such as myself feel this was an improvement over it. The atmosphere in itself is just dark, metallic, tense, and irks danger more often than not. The way the world is built around this is pretty damn good too, it does it right.Unlike Afraid of Monsters where ammunition worked in the same way as Half-Life, this game does it tradionally, with there being a magazine counter rather than total rounds in reserve; any time you reload you dump all the rounds in the last mag, no ifs ands or butts about it, it's gone.

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												Cry of Fear is a first person and co-op horror game that was formerly a mod for Half Life 1. You play as Simon, a disturbed man that gets hit by a car and wakes up in an alley. As you wander aimlessly through the dark Scandinavian night, you get attacked by vairous monsters and demons that represent your life before and after the accident. Throuout the game, you encounter many disturbing hallucinations, that progressively get more disturbing and dangerous as the game progresses. This game is a psychological horror, and only the bravest can witstand the entire game to its brutal conclusion. The game has multiple endings, each one having a slightly different scenario, thirty unlockables, several custom campaigns, and a follow up co-op campaign, along with a custom co-op campaign. This game is dark, disturbing, and atmospheric.And it explains some of the things that people might experience after suffering from traumatic experiances. Sadly, the developers aren't making any more updates for it.

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2016
												This is by far the best horror game i have ever played!It has all the right elements for a good singleplayer story, since the creator knows exactly how to build up some tension and let you scare yourself sometimes, when you feel like something is going to happen. Even though it isn't "next-gen" graphics with mo-cap cutscenes and all that, it uses what it has very well.With that being said it's not perfect, at least not when it comes to multiplayer.I have been wanting to play with a lot of my friends, but i have only been able to do that with my brother, because the only way to play with someone is by being in the same house (by using LAN). Although there is ways to do it with programs like Hamachi, it takes ages to set up and can be difficult.With that being said, i definitely think that its a game worth playing, especially if you love horror games.For me this is a game that i probably will, subconsciously, compare to any other horror game i'm going to play in the future.Score: 9.5/10Pros and Cons summary:+Great story+Bonus maps/storys+Nice level design+Scary atmosphere+Great multiplayer Co-op storyline+Original monsters+Not jumpscare-after-jumpscare based+Small puzzles from time to time (find keys/ropes etc, rotate statues)+Notes and secrets to intensify/expand the story-Cant play with friends unless you use programs like Hamachi-Not that many Co-op maps-Voiceover volume is sometimes very low-Small and few glitches from time to time

content:
Posted: June 9, 2016
												"This game contains violence and gore," warns the opening title screen, "and may cause fear, depression or suicide." I wonder: has this game actually caused suicide? Because if a game could, this would be it.Cry of Fear is by far the most dreadful thing I've seen since Penumbra: Black Plague, but when I say "dreadful," I don't mean "bad." I mean it fills you with dread. If there is such a thing as hell, it probably looks like Simon's nightmare world, not the fiery shores of DOOM 3, and depending on who you are, that's either the best reason to play it or the best reason to avoid it at all costs. Had this been its own game, not simply a Half-Life mod, it might have gone down as one the classics of horror gaming along with Amnesia and Silent Hill. In any case, it deserves more attention.

												Alright, so this game is terrrifying. Not because of normal reasons like why outlast or more action horror related games, i.e. resident evil. No. This game has a serious and deep sense of dread, the atmosphere is some of the best i've ever seen in a horror game. The visuals and textures are of course very dated but it makes up for it and more with the audio. H o l y h e c k. The audio to this game is absolutely phenominal. Some of the sounds the enemies make are just incredibely haunting. I'm a seasoned horror veteran and I had trouble facing another corner just to hear a shriek of a weird masked hoody dude with a screwdriver. Overall for what it is, a free horror game, the best free horror game i've ever came across. 10/10

number of helpful: 44 of 82 people (54%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 9, 2015
												Cry of Fear is a big achievement when it comes to Half-Life mods. It is total conversion, it has a lot of graphical detail and some nice graphics put into it compared to something running on an old Quake-like game. The graphical element is really well nailed in this game.Gameplay is pretty solid most of the time, the weapons are fun to use and I like the way you have to use items to continue forth. Now the cons: It took me a while to realize that reloading my gun also meant losing any leftover ammo in the clip. That felt like a bit of a snag, Ihaven't seen any game other than Cry of Fear do that, and I doubt any game will do it again, for a reason. It wasn't a big problem, but I felt it was just frustrating.Now one more problem I had was the unnecessary bactracking. I think this is more of a design flaw, because the player's inventory made no difference between weapons, mission items and other items. I had to drop things, carry an item over to an objective, then get back to carry the rest. It was kind of annoying.The combat pacing was also off, a lot of times I felt like some areas could've done without having any enemies around, and in those places the combat felt unnecessary, and even detrimental. I'm going to expand on this more when I talk about the story.Cry of Fear obviously takes a lot of inspiration from games like Silent Hill 2, it dwells into the psychological horror category, but I think it fails to really capture the spirit of the genre. The game relies too much on jump scares and "creepy" monsters with no real substance behind them to try and scare the player. Most of the time it's way too much in the player's face as well. For example, the the nightmare sequence with the head in the middle making faces and spinning around ends up looking really goofy, and that's just the tip of the iceberg.The story doesn't feel like it really connects with the gameplay, with only a few cutscenes that don't really feel like they influence the course of the game itself. They also feel like they come out of nowhere. Let me elaborate:  this is especially the case with the cutscene where Simon's girlfriend kills herself. It felt like they were put in solely because a game in this genre needs cutscenes. We were meant to feel something, but we don't really care because up until then, we had no idea who Sophie was. She just pops out of nowhere. The story's simplicity becomes really apparent at the ending.The subplot with the pedophile♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥murderer in the apartments left me wanting to find out what was going on, what it was all about. However the subplot is never, ever expanded upon. You never find out how it is relevant to the story, or what happened to the guy, or how it connects with Simon. Could it be that Simon found his journals, was onto him, and he tried to silence Simon by hitting him with his car? The car accident in the beginning looked very deliberate. I was expecting it to be related to his incident, but the entire subplot never goes anywhere. That's another missed opportunity.This is also where I go back to my point regarding enemy placement. I think the game had a perfect opportunity to focus on it's atmosphere in the last part, where you're in the city and it's sunny. The monsters just felt out of place, and ruined an atmosphere that the game actually succeeded in building up. This atmosphere of anticipation, the feeling of a long journey being concluded. Had there been no monsters after the sun rises, it would've made the ending a whole lot better. Simon survived the night, he got out of the dark and there are no monsters left. The ending would've been less anticipated to turn out weirdly. I felt like the game at this point really missed it's chance to make a good twist that was very much needed, a twist that would've surprised and satisfied players.Overall I think Cry of Fear could've done with a bit more fine-tuning when it comes to gameplay, but that's not my main gripe. The game just misses so many of it's chances to be legitimately unnerving, creepy and atmospheric, trading it for dumb combat with monsters I just can't find scary at all, and filling up with cheap jump scares or backfired "scary"content that ends up looking comical. It had a tremendous amount of potential, but it completely failed to take advantage of the opportunities that were screaming to be grabbed by the balls. It's a game that throws in a lot of half baked concepts to look deep, but there's no real effort in the story otherwise. If the developers focused so much on the high quality of the graphics and the content, they could've at least focused on the story, the pacing and the atmosphere just as well. What really hurts this game for me is all the potential that was opened up by the developers, but ends up being completely misused, ignored and put aside.

content:
Posted: July 4, 2014
												Cry of Fear is a psycological horror-shooter in an area similar to Stockholm, Sweden. You play as Simon, just some ordinary guy suffering from severe depression and what I think, due to the monsters, some schizophrenia. The game starts off with a segment of a man crawling towards Simon, uging for help, but Simon does not respond in kind and harms the man, bashing his head into a wall. Then there's a few fades to a blood-soaked padded cell, but the blood seems to spell something. Then the game cuts back to Simon, who stands around for a second before getting hit by an off-roading vehicle. Then there is some gameplay where you take pictures of the letter X that reveal a sinister plot and then a face screaming at you in the end.Waking up in an alleyway with no recollection of what exactly happened before-hand armed with a (Slightly blood-stained) knife and a cell phone. Checking on his phone, he gets a text from his mother, urging him to come home, however; Simon cannot respond, as he has no service. (We all know that feeling, eh?) Then you embark on an adventure through the town on finding a way to get back home. This is the introduction to Cry of Fear, originally a Half-life mod and later a full Steam release, which I will be reviewing because I have no clue what the difference is but if there is one, you're getting the Steam release. This game is made by the same dev team who made Afraid of Monsters: Directors Cut. Winning quite a number of Indie Game awards, and rightfully so. But, just a fair warning, this game is grim and can cause nightmares.Some things could turn one off about this game, such as dated graphics and a slightly odd control scheme.Pros+Story Rich+Great voice acting+Amazing add-on maps+Spooks all around!+Guns don't feel too over-powered and feel as though they're tools for survival+Puzzles that aren't too difficult but aren't too easyCons-MP is difficult to operate without Hamachi-difficult platforming sections-monsters are a bit difficult if that's a con to you.Total rating: 9.75/10

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Well, this is really something else.Before playing Cry of Fear I wasn't really into horror games - in fact, I don't think I ever played any at all with the exception of a bit of Amnesia and SCP: Containment Breach. The reason I downloaded CoF was because it was a mod for HL1, and I was having serious Half-Life withdrawal symptoms at the time (seriously, where is episode 3?). What I got was not only an encouraging introduction into the horror genre, but one of the best games I've ever played in terms of character, story and suspense.In particular, the protagonist, a nineteen year old Swedish guy named Simon, really struck a chord with me. Before playing this game I was having some serious issues in my life, dealing with heartbreak and severe anxiety to name a few. I can't say much without spoiling the plot, but the mental trauma that he went through and the way he responded to it let me know that I wasn't alone with these problems. The immersive gameplay of CoF helped me a lot and allowed me to connect to the protagonist more than any other before.But anyway. As far as gameplay goes, it's relatively simple - if you've HL1 or any other Valve-made FPS, you should have no problem learning the controls. Unique to CoF is the inventory system, in which you can store up to 6 items, and the ability to duel-wield specific weapons. The puzzles are also challenging without being ridiculously hard, and if you get stuck like I did on the "park puzzle" with the statues then don't be afraid to look the answer up on Youtube.One criticism though. In order to avoid cheating, the developers have removed most of the console commands which would help you if, say, you're halfway through the game with low health, no ammo, and stuck in a room with 6 monsters armed only with your switchblade. This happened to me and I actually had to go into the game files and modify the damage values for the switchblade in order to progress. Not cool, Team Psykskallar, not cool! What if somebody encountered a game-breaking bug and got stuck in a wall or something? They wouldn't be able to noclip out. Still, that's pretty much the only criticism I have about this game. Everything else is spot on. If you're a hardened horror fan or relatively new to the genre like me, be sure to give it a go. It's free, after all.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 4, 2014
												Cry of Fear is a psycological horror-shooter in an area similar to Stockholm, Sweden. You play as Simon, just some ordinary guy suffering from severe depression and what I think, due to the monsters, some schizophrenia. The game starts off with a segment of a man crawling towards Simon, uging for help, but Simon does not respond in kind and harms the man, bashing his head into a wall. Then there's a few fades to a blood-soaked padded cell, but the blood seems to spell something. Then the game cuts back to Simon, who stands around for a second before getting hit by an off-roading vehicle. Then there is some gameplay where you take pictures of the letter X that reveal a sinister plot and then a face screaming at you in the end.Waking up in an alleyway with no recollection of what exactly happened before-hand armed with a (Slightly blood-stained) knife and a cell phone. Checking on his phone, he gets a text from his mother, urging him to come home, however; Simon cannot respond, as he has no service. (We all know that feeling, eh?) Then you embark on an adventure through the town on finding a way to get back home. This is the introduction to Cry of Fear, originally a Half-life mod and later a full Steam release, which I will be reviewing because I have no clue what the difference is but if there is one, you're getting the Steam release. This game is made by the same dev team who made Afraid of Monsters: Directors Cut. Winning quite a number of Indie Game awards, and rightfully so. But, just a fair warning, this game is grim and can cause nightmares.Some things could turn one off about this game, such as dated graphics and a slightly odd control scheme.Pros+Story Rich+Great voice acting+Amazing add-on maps+Spooks all around!+Guns don't feel too over-powered and feel as though they're tools for survival+Puzzles that aren't too difficult but aren't too easyCons-MP is difficult to operate without Hamachi-difficult platforming sections-monsters are a bit difficult if that's a con to you.Total rating: 9.75/10

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												Do you like first-person-shooter games?  Do you like Silent Hill types of survival horror games?  Do you like those two types of games blended together?  If the answer is no to these questions, then don't get Cry of Fear for free.  If the answer is yes, then stop reading this and download this game already.  I'm only up to the first boss as I type this review, but from what I've played so far I can tell you that I really like this game.  It has inventory space to have to juggle things you find.  It has duel wielding which you can change up on the fly via pressing the weapon keys of your choice together.  It has different weapon forms you can switch up via right click if one weapon equipped. Then there's things to keep in mind when duel wielding.  If you're duel wielding the knife and gun let's say, when you run out of ammo, you have to switch to just having the gun equipped so that you can reload it.  There is a lot of weapon management needed to keep you on your toes.  The enemies so far don't dissapoint in the jump-scare factor.  The game is downright creepy overall anyway.  So far the story seems interesting enough.  I did start a new game to play through the early areas again, and I can tell you that they change up the codes for doors and what-not.  You can't just speed-run knowing what the codes were.  You have to search out the clues again making it more worthy of a replay.  I also have read that this game is quite long, and has multiple endings, although I'm only an hour or two into it so far.  Now there are a few glitches here and there that I've found, and it also has crashed on me once as I died fighting the first boss.  Hopefully that won't be more common as I play on.  Even with a little glitching, I still say this game is well worth giving it a try.  It's one of the best free games I've tried on Steam.  Hell if they came out with a new updated version with better graphics and all, I'd buy it.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
												Things I liked about Cry of FearVisuals were great for a goldsource game, I would forget it was half life 1 engine sometimes.Animations are great, spooky enemies and stuff.Monster design is extremely gruesome and great with the meaning behind each enemy making it even better.Music and sound is superbLittle bits like the inertia and such is greatGame is long lasting and hard to forgetNice nightmare scenesBad thingsBiggest issue for me still is the inventory management. It has a resident evil 1 style layout (Aka keys take up a slot, just like an m16 or shotgun) and it would be fine if you didn't have to drop all weapons to carry the keys to the next area then run back and pick them up again.I didn't like the character development for Simon or that one chick (Cant remember her name), they felt emotionless and boring.Iron sights are useless and unneeded.Certain segments easy and some stupid (Sawrunner v1)The endings made me upset physically (except the great secret ending)Multiplayer was tough to get set upLose half your already ♥♥♥♥♥♥ inventory and all weapons 3/4's into the gameSimon has asthma and cant run worth♥♥♥♥♥♥br>All in all I liked this game, I beat it when it was in beta still (Pre steam release) and I enjoyed it, past its flaws, and I would recommend it to any horror fan.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
												When it works, it works well. That being said, finding that sweet spot took a little bit of effort for a reward resulting from  successful ammo management and exploration.Most struggles arose from the back end of things - setting up the server using Hamachi wasn't impossible, but made playing the game a little more frustrating. Switching map on the server kicked everyone out, forcing everyone to rejoin again. Sometimes upon map load people would lose connection entirely, forcing a server reboot and progress to be lost. Some maps would seperate players into their own seperate instances - spooky, but concerning when most levels require the buddy system to survive.Enjoying Cry of Fear depends on the resiliency of the player(s). Some levels concisted of a neat gauntlet of ammo management among players, a puzzle of meleeing certain enemies, while having ammo to gun down larger foes. However, this scarcity of ammo turned the game from a scavenging horror game into simply a puzzle with the curtain of horror pulled down. Some levels employ simple platforming, those new to Source physics might find it a little overwhelming and those familiar may dislike how finicky some of the jumps can get.Despite all of this, the enjoyment just barely outweighed the frustration and it still made for an entertaining night among friends.It's free. It's ok.
