content:
Posted: February 2, 2014
												One of the best survival horrors out there. The influence of Silent Hill (especially 2) is clearly visible on both gameplay and theme, but capturing that kind of atmosphere and mood can only be a compliment, A huge one. And worry not because Cry of Fear does have a really strong identity of it's own.The limitations of the Gold Source engine are barely noticeble due to just how much the original game was modifyed, however, like Half Life, Cry of Fear also changes gameplay mechanics from times to times, depending on the scenario you're in. For a horror game, Cry of Fear does this tremendously well, and except for a few moments of the game (like the falling train sequence) the game manages to use the change of it way of playing as a way of provoking fear into the player rather than frustration, since from a moment to another you will be forced to think in a different way if you want to progress. The story like I said earlier, is incredibly influenced by Silent Hill, however, it is obvious that alot of it came from the creator's life experiences. One thing I must criticize is that not all monsters seem to represent imidiatly Simons guilt and fears, some of them are just twisted and disturbing for the sake of being twisted and disturbing, but, while they dont offer much in terms of the main characters' psyche, they do offer more variety of gameplay, since Cry of Fear does have many diferent types of enemies. All I can say plot-wise is that it takes it's time to reveal what's actually going on, and the closer you get to the truth, the more twisted and nightmaqrish the visuals of the game will become, to express the depression and suicidal tendencies of the protagonist. The gameplay is filled with subtle details that are mostly overlooked even by the greatest of the surival horror genre, wether old or new. The presence of those elements only make this game grimmer and genuinly terrifying, since they add depth to the game, and you will have to consider their use if you want to survive due to the scarce resources. I was also incredibly impressed due to the quantity of bonus material. You get a bunch of new game modes, extra weapons, developer commentary, diferent outfits, trophys, pages of Simon's book, and also, parts of the game switch simply by starting new playtroughts. For example, codes for specific doors change so you cant simply resort to online help to solve a puzzle. There are also TONS of easter eggs in the game, 4 diferent endings on the main singleplayer, theres multiplayer and 4 different difficulty settings. Also, props to the sound design and music, it's also great.For a free game this is absolutly amazing, and for such a small team of developers... Then my god you guys have created a masterpiece. It is one of the scariest games I've ever played, dont let the terrible jumpscare screamer at the beginning reflect how the rest of the game is gonna be. And if you like Cry of Fear, then I highly recoment Afraid of Monsters as well, but that one you will have to install like a regular Half Life mod. This game, at least for me, proved that both game with combat or without combat can be just as scary as one another, taking diferent routes for their game design.So, if you are a horror fan, why arent you playing Cry of Fear yet?

content:
Posted: March 14, 2016
												Cry of Fear is a free-to-play horror game and was published on Steam in April 2013.You'll play as Simon, a teenager, who finds himself caught up in a nightmarish version of his hometown with only one objective - to find your way back home... You'll get to solve a couple of puzzles and you'll fight the monsters that hunt you throughout the game - this can prove quite tricky since amo is fairly scarce and the bosses of the game all require different tactics... Overall the games atmosphere and design is quite well done, the monsters are scary and the bosses and rooms prove to be quite disturbing as well! The story evolves as you progress in the game and focuses a lot on Simon - I wont spoil anything but there are different endings which conclude the games story really well! The whole approach is kind of "Silent Hill-ish" and interesting to play.The games graphics are based on the Halfe Life 1 engine and thus not good compared to modern standards, but the design is done really well and presumably WILL scare you a couple of times, mainly due to the variation of the different areas as you progress through the game...Overall I can recommend you to play Cry of Fear - if the graphics don't scare you off or if you like horror games with sinister stories in general! Being a free game, Cry of Fear is certainly worth the few hours you'll spent on playing it alone - or with friends.

content:
Posted: April 29, 2013
												Re-reviewing this. It's an amazing horror game in all senses of it. Lots of replay value. Wonderfully scary, doesn't rely too much on jumpscares, even if it uses them here and there. The atmosphere is amazing for a GoldSrc game. The soundtrack just immerses you in the story. The story is nice too, depressing to say the least. Frustrating puzzles from time to time that take a bit of brainstorming to solve are scattered around singleplayer.If you're going to get into this, there are three things you need to know. You're going to get scared, you're going to get frustrated from time-to-time, and you're going to get pretty damn depressed. It's all good. Unless you're here for the multiplayer. Then you're here for balls-to-the-wall horror fun, with friends. It's fun and all, but has neither the story nor the puzzles of the singleplayer. I say: Get it for the singleplayer, and play the multiplayer afterwards. I wasn't dissapointed, and I hope you won't be either.

content:
Posted: March 29, 2014
												[Potential Spoilers!]Cry of Fear is a psycological horror-shooter in an area similar to Stockholm, Sweden. You play as Simon, just some ordinary guy suffering from severe depression and what I think, due to the monsters, some schizophrenia. The game starts off with a segment of a man crawling towards Simon, uging for help, but Simon does not respond in kind and harms the man, bashing his head into a wall. Then there's a few fades to a blood-soaked padded cell, but the blood seems to spell something. Then the game cuts back to Simon, who stands around for a second before getting hit by an off-roading vehicle. Then there is some gameplay where you take pictures of the letter X that reveal a sinister plot and then a face screaming at you in the end.Waking up in an alleyway with no recollection of what exactly happened before-hand armed with a (Slightly blood-stained) knife and a cell phone. Checking on his phone, he gets a text from his mother, urging him to come home, however; Simon cannot respond, as he has no service. (We all know that feeling, eh?) Then you embark on an adventure through the town on finding a way to get back home. This is the introduction to Cry of Fear, originally a Half-life mod and later a full Steam release, which I will be reviewing because I have no clue what the difference is but if there is one, you're getting the Steam release. This game is made by the same dev team who made Afraid of Monsters: Directors Cut. Winning quite a number of Indie Game awards, and rightfully so.  But, just a fair warning, this game is grim and can cause nightmares.Some things could turn one off about this game, such as dated graphics and a slightly odd control scheme.Pros+Story Rich+Great voice acting+Amazing add-on maps+Spooks all around!+Guns don't feel too over-powered and feel as though they're tools for survival+Puzzles that aren't too difficult but aren't too easyCons-MP is difficult to operate without Hamachi-difficult platforming sections-monsters are a bit difficult if that's a con to you.Total rating: 9.75/10

Posted: June 9, 2014
												When I first downloaded Cry of Fear on my Steam, I thought I wouldn't be that scared by it seeing as I laugh at retro graphics (and all of the enemies you come across in the first Half Life game). However, I was wrong. The game's only elements of fear are from its jumpscares and they are pretty damn terrifying. I no longer require sleep anymore (but who needed that anyway?). The graphics are kinda old looking but that makes the game even worse because it causes the enemies to look more grotesque than a realistic game would. I prefer playing retro games anyway and I always find non-realistic looking games to look and play much better. On the whole, a terrifyingly-poopdedoop yourself- enjoyable experience and I highly recommend this game if you enjoy survival horror games, like Half Life mods (or are constipated).

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 29, 2014
												[Potential Spoilers!]Cry of Fear is a psycological horror-shooter in an area similar to Stockholm, Sweden. You play as Simon, just some ordinary guy suffering from severe depression and what I think, due to the monsters, some schizophrenia. The game starts off with a segment of a man crawling towards Simon, uging for help, but Simon does not respond in kind and harms the man, bashing his head into a wall. Then there's a few fades to a blood-soaked padded cell, but the blood seems to spell something. Then the game cuts back to Simon, who stands around for a second before getting hit by an off-roading vehicle. Then there is some gameplay where you take pictures of the letter X that reveal a sinister plot and then a face screaming at you in the end.Waking up in an alleyway with no recollection of what exactly happened before-hand armed with a (Slightly blood-stained) knife and a cell phone. Checking on his phone, he gets a text from his mother, urging him to come home, however; Simon cannot respond, as he has no service. (We all know that feeling, eh?) Then you embark on an adventure through the town on finding a way to get back home. This is the introduction to Cry of Fear, originally a Half-life mod and later a full Steam release, which I will be reviewing because I have no clue what the difference is but if there is one, you're getting the Steam release. This game is made by the same dev team who made Afraid of Monsters: Directors Cut. Winning quite a number of Indie Game awards, and rightfully so.  But, just a fair warning, this game is grim and can cause nightmares.Some things could turn one off about this game, such as dated graphics and a slightly odd control scheme.Pros+Story Rich+Great voice acting+Amazing add-on maps+Spooks all around!+Guns don't feel too over-powered and feel as though they're tools for survival+Puzzles that aren't too difficult but aren't too easyCons-MP is difficult to operate without Hamachi-difficult platforming sections-monsters are a bit difficult if that's a con to you.Total rating: 9.75/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 10, 2015
												Cry of Fear is made off of a Half-Life mod and is surprisingly very well made. Developers clearly did put a lot off work in this game. However I am apparently stuck on the second chapter as I don't have enough ammo hence I'm unable to progress, but I did manage to watch the game on YouTube to get an idea about the game.The story-telling is good, clearly took inspiration from Silent Hill series. Gameplay is clunky (but challenging) and graphics well look decent, which is understandable since it was developed by a small team. The atmosphere is great, the monsters are scary and creepy, sounds were excellent and the visuals add up to the scary/creepy vibe. It's a great game and probably the best game for a mod and a free game.Now why I don't recommend this game? In my case, which is pretty rare I managed to have barely any ammo left and now to progress through I don't have any way to fight off the enemies. I played at medium difficulty. I loved this game until I got stuck. I get the fact that it was supposed to be challenging but if you ♥♥♥♥ up there is no going back. Very fursturating!! Also the jumpscares kinda get predictable later, you just expect the monsters to be out there lurking. I think it would be better if the monsters were not put in some part of the game for the sake of unpredictability factor.Some subplots could be explained better but they are completely ignored.So yeah overall a great game however my experience was ruined because of the poor design which i unfortunaetly was the victim of. I recommend people to try this game out. Also it is free so just go for it!

												We all have heard things about being alone, but we've never completely experienced it...That's why this game was created. This game puts you in Simon's mind, all alone, to feel what he feels, and experience what really means to be alone, in your mind. Even if you're not a fan of horror games (like me), give this game a shot and you'll love the atmosphere and the ambience of the game through the first playthrough.The Doctor's story was rather short, but it was worth unlocking it.The CO-OP campaign has a really impressive story and gameplay....Still didn't get my opinion did you? ok so here it is: The best horror modification (even a full game) ever made.Also it's free so you got no problem getting it now.Yes, right now.P.S: This was my first review. ^^

The only thing that annoys me is that Cry of Fear isn't 100% accurate with ammo plus I also don't like the fact that if you open your inventory, the game is still going on. So if you're going to look through your inventory make sure you're in a safe place with no monsters around, or you will die.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2015
												This game is terrifying to play by yourself. Of course, that's part of the fun. I liked how there are other game types other than just the campaign, and the campaign itself has good replayability. You can go back and find all the secret nuggets hidden about, and unlock in-game items. Gameplay is smart and realistic, like how I had to sacrifice a light source to use a knife and gun in both my hands. This isn't a game you play for stunning graphics, but I enjoyed the enemy designes; especially the pregnant woman with the baby clawing at you from her stomach. I had to take a break after that one to calm down.  The only things I have against it are the jump scares and multiplayer. If you don't do so well with scary shnikey popping out of nowhere nearly constantly, you may have difficulty playing this game. There were many times when I thought I was going to have a heart attack, one right after the other. It opens up a big bag of nope for me. It's like the game relies too heavily on that tactic. Well, that and rediculously fast hostiles that make you panic and get yourself killed. For multiplayer the option is there, but it is practically nonexistent. There is no server upkeep, so I was forced to download seperate programs to try it out. I had to create a profile for different clients and host a room that lasted only a day. Once I got in a game it was actually pretty fun, with up to four players and multiple choices for game-types. Setup is just a pain in the backside. All the pros and cons aside, free is free. If you want to be scared this halloween, or any other time of the year, it is worth playing with the lights out and headphones at full volume.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												Personally, I love how this game was made. I love the gloom in almost every atmosphere, I love the design of the creatures you face. I love how the game is shaped around Simon's well-being, and you play through his depression and anxiety. This game is really one you can get stuck into, and there's a lot to learn about the game. If you like psychological horror games based on real life, this is a great game for you! One downfall is that I don't like the saving system and that you can only save in Medium and Hard difficulty. I'd love it if we were able to save in Easy too? Overall, I rate this game a 9/10.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2016
 Cry of Fear...Cry of Fear is a detailed game with a excellent story that is being told. Simon's Story in a nutshell -~ Simon is a 19 year old male and an individual plagued with anxiety and depression. Before the events of Cry of Fear (as seen in the first cutscene of the game), Simon was the victim of a hit and run wherein he was pinned to a building by a car whilst trying to help an injured man late at night. While he surprisingly survived the incident, he was crippled from the waist down and confined to a wheelchair for the rest of his life, subjecting him to further mental trauma which drove him into becoming reclusive and spiteful of his own life. Doctor Purnell was assigned as Simon's psychiatrist following the accident, and using Cognitive Therapy, Simon was instructed to write a book about his emotions and anxiety to get all the trauma out of his head. Simon and PurnellPurnell talking with Simon about his treatment.Simon authored the book as instructed and the events of Cry of Fear begin - the events unfolding being a metaphorical depiction of Simon's mind and his battle to purge his inner demons through writing, the actions taken during the game showing how well the therapy works.The Simon played as over the course of Cry of Fear is in fact a mental projection of Simon and what combats the trauma inside the real one's mind. The fate of both Simons depends on what ending is unlocked due to the actions made during the game.^ That may be a lot but that mostly is Simon's background.- This game also carries some good Co-op experience, meaning that the co-op is pretty fun and shares another story about how the Police is trying to find Simon to help him out and take him somewhere to get help while you go on a wild adventure meeting some creepy things.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2015
												By far one of the best horror games I've played, the best part being priceless. Offers co-op up to four people for an even greater in-depth horror experience with your friends, with new jump scares and an add-on to the main storyline. This game is full of jump scares, but best of all has an amazing; mind boggling storyline that will continue to suck you in. Highly recommended to those in love with the horror genre, looking for something to give them a new fright but also giving a real story.

content:
Posted: April 9, 2014
												This game is incredible.Now, I could go on for a very long time explaining, in depth, what I mean, but I'm going to keep this brief.I have been gaming since I was three years old. I have played a LOT of video games.That being said, Cry of Fear is THE MOST UNCOMFORTABLE a video game has EVER made me feel.People say that videos games are a new art medium. If the point of art is to make you experience emotions...BOY DID I HAVE A BUNCH OF EMOTIONS PLAYING THIS GAME.It psychologically profiles you as you play it (although it does it very subtly, so much so that I only realised it during my second playthrough), and it will invoke feelings of confusion, sadness, and reverence for the mind of Simon (the main protagonist). Team Psykskaller did a fantastic job doing the writing of this game, and even in the most basic, low level monsters, there is symbolism to be found.Anyone who is tired of the generic slasher horror, and wants an almost overwhelming psychological trip, play this game.It is the only horror game that I (being someone who's scared easily) fully enjoy and would play through it multiple times all the way to the end.10/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												Amazing horror game. Definitely one of the scariest horror games that I have played. It heavily depends on sudden and sometimes "cheap" jumpscares to scare you, but that's okay, it's something that most AAA games are afraid to do, what a  shame, it actually works good if used correctly.The game gives you the means to defend yourself (knife, guns ect.) and that is a nice change from all the recent horror games that the only thing that you can do is run, and hope for the best (Amnesia, Outlast, Slender ect.)The old graphics may not be the most pleasing to look at, nevertheless, the atmosphere that they have created with the half life engine is pretty creepy. The music and sound effects are great too. Finally it's a completely free game (you have the ability to donate in-game and recieve a special weapon), so I can't see why you souldn't download it!tl;dr Great horror game, a must download for horror fans!

content:
Posted: March 17, 2015
												to be honest i thought of the good points quickly but it actually took a while to think of some negative ones about the game (because that's what people really want to hear in reviews), so here are some upsides and things that could be improved upon in my opinion and you can make up your own mindsome good thingsit's a survival horror first person. it has all the elements, jump scares, little ammo, dark atmos, creppy bad guys, etc..it's built on the hl1 engine i think?? it does amazing things!! hd resolutions, proper inventory with notes, quick slots, dual wielding, stamina. wasn't hl1 build on cry of fear's engine??difficult at times. what survival horror isn't. it wouldn't be a survival horror otherwise. it's not unfair at all, just difficult like a survival horror should beup to 4 player co-opthings that can be improved upon and/or implementeda map?? it's not like you have many places to go, it's not an open world. it's quite linear in fact but a map would be nice sometimes, just for some notes??just about all the bad guys are the same just do more or less damage and look different. they're normally quick (faster than you are anyways), they see you, charge, and attackverdictthose bad things could even be intentional and aren't necessarily bad things either, just my personal flave i guess

												This game made my friend crap himself on the introduction.It's that scary.Cry of fear is a single player and co-op game where you play as a guy who wakes up in an alley and has to find his way back home.The story is absolutely amazing, and yet at the same time it will crush your feels like a bug.Sure, this game is old, and is based on the HL1 engine, but who cares?! It's still as fun as ever. And there's multiple endings, so you can play as many times as you want.The co-op, in my opinion, is so much fun. You are cops who have teamed up to destroy the zombies/monsters that have invaded the town. I love the fact that at the start of the final level, it gives you VP70's, sledgehammers and shotguns.So, if you're looking for a spoop, play this game. And then cry afterwards, because your feels are destroyed.It's free, too. Bonus!

Posted: July 23, 2014
												At first glance it looks like "Another dumb, free horror game,". But it is honestly much more. All I played was Co-Op campaign with my friends, beating it would usually take 3-4 hours at most. I played 15 hours.The game is so much fun with friends, and no matter how many times you play a level, it never gets old. I recommend this game entirely. It's free, fun, and will give you hours of enjoyment, why not pick it up?

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												Absolutely amazing game. I don't know why people would not download this game since it's one of the best on steam and it's FREE. Like a first person Silent Hill game with more action and shooting, but the action doesn't ruin it. The only issue I have is the fact that the multiplayer is completely broken. It's almost impossible to play with friends let alone other people. Unfortunately with no new news or updates there looks like there hasn't been any efforts to fix it either. The only way you'll be able to play is if you find someone (such as myself) that portforwarded the game.... or if they use Hamachi like a scroob. I have hosted games for multiple people and beat the co-op campaigns multiple times, so if you're interested but have no friends to host, add me and I will if I'm not busy. If for nothing else though, download it for the campaign, it's free... so why not?

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 11, 2015
												I cannot like this game, i have tried. Monsters and gore doesnt make an horror game, and jumpscares are not scary at all, you just react to an unexpected situation or a loud noise (yeah headphones FTW).I preffer horror games that build tension, leaving you a nerve wrack, and THEN try to scare you in a situation that you cant fight back. For me guns in horror games its just a no-go (one of the reasons Doom 3 wasnt scary at all) they destroy the game fear atmosphere.Any person that played his fair share of horror games will see most situations coming, youll enter a room saying to yourself "im going to be attacked now" and you will probably be right. Enemies move silent and in fast-foward, but most attack with the speed of a snail and easy to read. Enemies will stop at obstacles like ledges, so, if there is one available that you can climb, its basically standing still free shooting galery for you. That and the character insists in getting stuck in a wall or two and items like ammo or seringes are really hard to spot.The game certainly has its moments, the start with the camera was cool, even if the jumpscare at the end was seen coming at a mile but still jumped with the fact i got a dude trying to destroy my eardrums, the maze where you eard the chainsaw guy in a distance was nice too, because it left me on full alert trying to figure if i was goint to fight him in those tight corridors or not.Its a niche game, if you enjoy cheap jumpscares and dont mind the little bugs. I can certainly recommend Cry of fear for you. If you, like me, preffer the "Amnesia" or "Slenderman" style horror, that leaves you defenseless and powerless against an all might foe. Then by all means, ignore this one.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
												So, i guess its time for write a review for this awesome game.Cry of Fear its an horror game developed by Team Psykskallar.They also made the amazing Half Life 1 mod ''Afraid of Monsters''which is also coming soon to Steam for free and it will include Co-op andenhanced graphics.Anyway, this game talks about Simon, a guy who was hurted by a carand that it maked him paralyzed on a wheel chair.After this crash anyway, you wake up on a street unconoscious, you mustfind out what's happening and try to go back to ''home''... if you can still call it home uh.Ok, i'm not gonna talk anymore about the Story.Now instead, i will talk about some other things like the graphics etc...The game runs on GoldSRC Engine (same Half Life 1 Engine) and the graphics are great for such an old engine!Also, the game has a lot of scary enemy's like the ''Sawer'' which is... well, you will see with your eyes ;)The game also has 2 co-op campaigns up to a max of 4 players + a co-op survival game mode.So yeah, should you try out this game? Is it scary?Yes and yes.Its such a great scary game with lots of jumpscares.Vote: 11/10 -ign lel

content:
Posted: September 27, 2014
												I'm not good at horror games. I'm rather good at the original Silent Hill though. Thats the kinda vibe this game gave me when I first played it. You wake up in a strange place with hardly any explanantion or anything and then *BAM* jumpscare. I first played this game at school with my friends, bad idea. The controls are solid. This game started as a mod for Half-Life so of course the controls are good. The graphichs look nice (a bit dated) and the film grain effect adds a nice touch of horror. I tried to play it, couldn't get past the opening. I don't really have any niggles with the game (haven't played much) but the loading times can take long and crash sometimes. When I first played it, I saw the task manager open at least 4 times. When it got running, it was rather freightining. I've tried to convince my mates to get it as it has CO-OP, but they don't like horror games. As we like to say: 3 spooky, 5 me. Its free so download it if you like horror, want to wet yourself or you're just insane. Haven't played enough to give a proper rating, but the game looks promising. For now its an 8/10 with a scare factor of 9/10.

content:
Posted: April 27, 2013
												Cry of Fear is a First Person Shooter Survival Horror game and was originally a Half-Life mod, but now it's a standalone game. This game runs on the Goldsource engine and it's amazing how good and detailed the game looks on such an old engine. This game features a huge single-player campaign and a coop campaign as well. With a terrifying atmosphere, twisted monsters and tons of scares, if you love Survival Horror games you can't miss this one out. Since it's free, there's no reason to not give this one at least a try.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												This is a very good game here are some pros and cons...PRO'S-*Gameplay is smooth*The graphics are great for an older game like this*There is the occasional jumpscare*The surrounding are that you play in clearly had a lot of time put into it and is very detailedCON'S-*Only a couple of the jumpscares will actually scare you (this may be a good thing for some people but for me, i want a scary game)*The multiplayer maps are small*Nobody plays the multiplayer*This is a common problem but, the phone that is supposed to be used as a light, well the screen does not light up at all and this makes the game hard to play in dark areasI do recommend this game but pleas fix some of these problems!!!! Iwould give this game a   7.5 out of 10 because of some of these problems.. fix these and it could easily be an 8 or 9

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												Cry of Fear is one of they best FREE horror games you can pick up on Steam.Although I see that many of my friends haven't completed the game cause of the scare factor,you have to look past that and see the beauty of the Half Life 1 Engine in modern time.I have to say the mapping is amazing well done by Rumple and great voice acting by the three actors.But the most amazing part of this in my opinion is how they tried to make Stockholm from playing this game Iwould love to visit Sweden to see the city. Also after your long first playthrough of CoF you unlock Doctor Mode and Nightmare Mode which adds hours of death and sorrow. The unlockables is one of the reasons I come back to get them all. Another reason is the many custom stories you can play! Sadly Team Psykskallars is no longer supporting custom stories but they're are still being made and are downloadable on the internet! I do recommend this game for any horror fan or story lovers maybe both!

content:
Posted: November 3, 2013
												Well this game should be consider as a hidden gem..Originaly it was HL1 mod but now after year of developing it has become game, not just simple mod and its completely free. Graphics are like from CS 1.6 but much better. Anyway who cares about graphics if you have   awesome atmosphere and sounds :)Cry of Fear contains a single player campaign that claims to take about eight hours time.  The gameplay is like most survival horror games. Atmosphere is great, the dark corridors, the creepy forests to a tight packed school, the environments are varied and have a great way of getting you in the mood and into the game. Another aspect of the atmosphere in sound, Cry of Fear has not only a wonderful soundtrack with scary, dark tracks to beautiful melodies, but the sound in the game. Whether they are foot steps around the corner edging closer or bumping on the walls or a scream in the distance, Cry of Fear definitely full fills the scare factor.Story is simple - game set in a deserted town filled with horrific creatures and nightmarish delusions. You play as a young man desperately searching for answers in the cold Scandinavian night, finding his way through the city as he slowly descends into madness. If you are survival horror fan, you should try this game, maybe you will like it as much as i do.I rate this game very nicely although it has little bit older graphics - 8/10

content:
Posted: August 19, 2015
												Honestly, Cry of Fear is a Powerful game in the ways of horror, the story is interesting to a point, in order to keep you playing. But on the better side the horror element is FANTASTIC!. There is ALOT! of effort into the "Jack in the Box" element and honestly, I can only see myself playing Cry of Fear in parts. I do not want to die from a heart attack (laughs) "ha-ha". But really the best things are.Pros.1) Fantastic!. Jack in the Box horror (jumpscares).2) Intresting story line.3) Good suspense.4) Makes you pray for safety (laughs) "ha-ha".Cons.1) So scary, it makes you play it in parts.2) Graphics.Now the Graphics are not that good, but it was a Modification for Half Life One but i like early two thousend game graphics i grew up with them so it. Does not bother me, I ACTUALLY, PREFER! early two thousend game graphics. But for those that want a fantastic graphical horror game then Silent Hill, Resident Evil, The Forest, Condemned One and Two, Doom III BFG Edition, and many others are the way to go BUT!. If you want a good game with awsome horror and an interesting storyline and if you are man enough, (laughs) "ha-ha" than Cry of Fear is the game for you!.P.S. "I hope to gain the courage to continue to traverse the Hotel in Part one."Rough Greek Translation.Ειλικρινά, Κραυγή Ο φόβος είναι ένα ισχυρό παιχνίδι με τους τρόπους του τρόμου, η ιστορία είναι ενδιαφέρουσα σε ένα σημείο, για να σας κρατήσει το παιχνίδι.Αλλά από την καλύτερη ομάδα το στοιχείο τρόμου είναι φανταστικό !. Υπάρχει πολύ! προσπάθειες για το "Jack in the Box" στοιχείο και ειλικρινά, μπορώ να δω τον εαυτό μου να παίζει μόνο Κραυγή του Φόβου σε τμήματα. Δεν θέλω να πεθάνουν από καρδιακή προσβολή (γέλια) «χα-χα".Αλλά πραγματικά τα καλύτερα πράγματα είναι.Πλεονεκτήματα.1) Φανταστική !. Jack in the Box τρόμου (jumpscares).2) intresting ιστορία γραμμή.3) Η καλή αγωνία.4) Σε κάνει να προσευχηθούν για την ασφάλεια (γέλια) «χα-χα".Μειονεκτήματα.1) είναι τόσο τρομακτικό, θα σας κάνει να το παίξετε σε τμήματα.2) γραφικών.Τώρα τα γραφικά δεν είναι τόσο καλή, αλλά ήταν μια τροποποίηση για το Half Life One, αλλά μου αρέσει νωρίς δύο, σε χιλιάδες γραφικά του παιχνιδιού μεγάλωσα μαζί τους γι 'αυτό. Δεν με ενοχλεί, εγώ πραγματικά προτιμούν! πρόωρη δύο γραφικά του παιχνιδιού, σε χιλιάδες. Αλλά για εκείνους που θέλουν ένα φανταστικό παιχνίδι τρόμου γραφικών τότε Silent Hill, Resident Evil, το δάσος, Καταδίκασε ένα και δύο, Doom III BFG Edition, και πολλοί άλλοι είναι ο τρόπος να πάει, αλλά !. Αν θέλετε ένα καλό παιχνίδι με awsome τρόμου και μια ενδιαφέρουσα ιστορία και, αν είστε αρκετά άντρας, (γέλια) «χα-χα" από ό, τι Κραυγή Ο φόβος είναι το παιχνίδι για εσάς !.Υ.Γ. "Ελπίζω να αποκτήσουν το θάρρος να συνεχίσει να διασχίσει το ξενοδοχείο σε ένα μέρος."

content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
												It's a very good game in general, and as far as horror games go it's the first I was really able to get into, though I'd played Amnesia and Outlast before Cry of Fear. I didn't actually beat either of those, and Cry of Fear is the first I've ever been able to finish aside from maybe Doom 3.Simple "Pros and Cons" Review:Pros:+Free+Impressive graphics for the GoldSource engine, and not really bad looking by any means in my opinion+Pretty good gameplay in general+Excellent atmosphere and soundtrack+Story is decent and I like how most of the monsters or environments can be significant to Simon's condition in general+Starts with a ridiculous jumpscare but still manages to make a lot of people scream in more surprise than anything+Getting jumpscared by some random ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥+Being able to shoot that random ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ in the face with a shotgun until he's dead+Sound design seems adequate+Voice acting is decent and gets the job doneCons:-Can be repetitive-A lot of backtracking, particularly the middle segment. I don't want to spoil much, but there's a big segment in them middle of the game where you have to backtrack through a big, bunch of seperate areas to retrieve fuses to open a door. It just feels like boring, tedious filler and I couldn't even figure out how to get through it or where to go without looking up a walkthrough.-Like I said before, sometimes it can be horribly tedious or vague on where you're supposed to go or what you're supposed to do. For example I spent 15-20 minutes trying to figure out what to do at a segment where you're given a shovel and spots to dig. I dug all the spots following the map and hadn't found a keycard I needed. Did I miss a spot or something? No, apparently not, it was behind a wall nearby, and the shovel and digging is really just to get things like extra ammo.-Sometimes there're too many jumpscares-Sometimes you don't have the ammo to shoot whatever ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ just jumpscared you-Nightmare mode is on steroids and I can't even get past the first guy on Nightmare difficulty, but it's probably possible I think-Co-op seems kinda buggy sometimesI can't really think of much else but all in all I kind of like it, and it's free, so that's even better. You can try it and if you don't like it there's not really much to worry about.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
												This game, is something. I'm going straight into the problems. For one starting a server up for a ♥♥♥♥♥. It kept crashing, we couldn't seem to get it to work nor could we even get into the first menu screen. When it comes to aimming which I have feeling the developers made it like this. But every time you shoot your gun, or use anything else. It completely misses the zombie. I don't know if the developers made it that way, but it gets really annoying after awhile. Now, on to the scares. First of all, let me make this clear. I'm a ♥♥♥♥♥, like a huge ♥♥♥♥ing wuss. Hell, I couldn't even watch a Steven King movie without screaming my head off. So of course I was scared while playing this, even with friends. The fact you have a useless gun that does zero damage doesn't help either. It makes you feel hopeless in ways, and of course scared. Now, going on to the graphics. Do you really need to rip this game? Of course the graphics are bad, BUT the atmosphere is a whole different story. I think a developer should focus more on what is going on around you, then what you see. What I mean by that a game can look ♥♥♥♥♥♥. But if it has a good atmosphere it shouldn't matter. Really graphics shouldn't matter IN THE FIRST PLACE. Anyways, when it comes to the scenery this game does it right. It feels like something demonic has happen, or it makes you feel like you're being watch. And that adds the creepy part to the game, it makes you feel frightened. Anyways, I give this game a 7/10.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												I haven't even gotten to my first savepoint.  I was laying here at night, in pitch blackness save for the dim light of my monitor when I thought I'd give this a try.In retrospect, that was a bad time to start.My heart nearly beat of of my chest within the first three minutes of play.  I must play more, but not until morning.  Great game so far.Update: Over 3 hours later, I have managed to get through Chapter 1.  This is a brilliant and taxing game.  I find myself praying for savepoints - not because I'm afraid of being killed and having to start over, but so I can take a break.  If you're looking for real horror, this is it.  One thing to note, if you're playing on 64 bit windows, you will need the crash patch available online.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												The best horror/thriller game I ever played so far.  Donated cause I had to support it.  Out of all the other horror games in my list, triple A expensive titles, this is the one that deserves my money the most.I'm working up the balls to play in Nightmare mode.  This game will either make you a man, or it will make you......cry out of fear.It even has an extra co-op campaign and supports community-made addons and content, and even has some official ones.  It has tons of replay value.  I am a co-op nut and I -really- admire the devs for going ahead with the co-op, even tho it is buggy.Chrissakes, it's a free game and it has so much features and content.  One of the best uses of the HL source engine, ever.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 10, 2014
												Andreas, James and team did a great work! Cry of Fear is one of the best FTP horror games you can play. Great psychological athmosphere and story, very good soundtrack and model/npcs design (especially Simon's model) and graphics. Really... Is it Half-Life GoldSource? Or is it Source? Yeah, it's GoldSrc, but they just pushed the engine to its limits. Dual wield is also good thing to include into the game. Water? Amazing! I wasn't even playing the game for the story but for the look of it! (ok, just joking :D) Anyway, great everything.Pros: - graphics, definitely improved GoldSrc and I appreciate this (10/10 [for GoldSrc]), - sounds/music, psychological and it reminded me of SH series (10/10), - story, really good and... again... psychological, you play as depressed man who walk in a haunted city and then you realize it was just his book, awesome! (9/10), - unlockables, the best of every game are unlockables, they keep you playing, because you want to own all of them (N/A), - scary as hell!, the most important part of horror is of course, horror [right? :D], you always think something will chase you or will jump on your face or something like this, I almost got a heart attack when crazy granny jumped into the vent in the subway's underground, or when sawrunner destroyed the door at the sewers at the almost end of game (ch7) (9/10), - difficulty, a little bit to much, but I like that kind of games! It's also cool that they implemented tape recorders to save instead of quick saving! Such an oldschool method, yup? (9/10), - animations 1/2, some of them are good, some are not, but I will say that I've seen even worse so I am placing them here (6/10). - easter eggs, they're so funny and really makes you feel happy for a second while being scaried all the time (10/10)Cons: - glitches, bugs, compatibility, I know you wanted to release this mod/game quickly, but then, when it got to Steam, you just didn't update it and the bugs just went across all the game. I remember that situation, when I had to change disk drives to play the game because of three/four hands and not working phone light (-1), - AI, seriously? Monsters which doesn't attack me when they are in front of me? This situation happened 4 times and it didn't happen in good place, examples: jumpscare (monster jumps right in front of my face), heart attack, and then... what... monster doesn't move and doesn't attack me. I can forgive it to you, because it didn't happen often and I know you updated AI in standalone version (monsters walking on stairs didn't exist in HL) (-0).Generally, I recommend this game to everyone who likes good and scary horror games and I hope Team Psykskallar will create other awesome projects like Cry of Fear and Afraid of Monsters! I give it 9,5/10 because of bugs and glitches, but anyway, it's very good! Thanks and keep makin' stuff! :)

content:
Posted: May 2, 2015
												Free horror games rarely get better than this.The atmosphere is great, the spooks are 2spooky, the gunplay feels nice, and the story is dark and interesting.Sure, it isn't perfect; the cinematics can be a bit wonky, the voice acting is meh, some difficulty spikes can be frustrating, and I got lost more times than I'd like to admit (which really killed the mood in one of scariest parts of the game).But, in spite of it's flaws, Cry of Fear is an excellent horror game that I highly recommend to anybody looking for more than a couple of spooks.

content:
Posted: February 2, 2014
												This is literally one of the greatest games ever created. It's scary, fun, exciting, and sad  as well. Surprise surprise in addition to being a truely amazing game, I found it helped with my own personal inadequacies, as the themes of self-hatred, sorrow, heartbreak and suicide are all no stranger to me. This game made me FEEL just as much as all the endings to the Ultimate Fallout New Vegas DLC made me FEEL. So much heartache and and understanding. 20/10, Cry of Fear goes above and beyond, breaking the 10/10 score by a longshot!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 27, 2013
												Cry of Fear is a First Person Shooter Survival Horror game and was originally a Half-Life mod, but now it's a standalone game. This game runs on the Goldsource engine and it's amazing how good and detailed the game looks on such an old engine. This game features a huge single-player campaign and a coop campaign as well. With a terrifying atmosphere, twisted monsters and tons of scares, if you love Survival Horror games you can't miss this one out. Since it's free, there's no reason to not give this one at least a try.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
												I don't want to give this a bad review and there's no middle between that and a good, so I'll just give it a good review because it wasn't overall bad. As someone who is an avid fan of horror games, I checked this game out after seeing good recommendations from other people. What I got from this game was a bit disappointing as I thought I would get more than a few jump scares. It showed a bit of promised during the intro and the first 5 minutes into the game, and I admit it was a little bit nerve racking in the first few minutes into it, but as soon as I got used to the atmosphere, I got bored of it and was craving for more. It didn't live up to my expectation. The enemies are dull and not at all terrifying to the point that I just run around the game hacking and slashing enemies as though I was in a knife fight with a COD player. However, again, this isn't an overall bad game. Maybe I'm just so used to the horror genre that I expected way too much from a free game. People should still check it out because it is still worth checking out.

content:
Posted: February 17, 2014
												If Cry of Fear doesn't have you on the edge of your seat, who knows, it is possible that another horror game will (but not likely). This game is not the worst horror experience I've ever had, but it is pretty scary! Take on the role of Simon, a depressed man who wakes up in a strange place to discover that there are monsters all over the city! Find new weapons and manage your inventory well, choosing which weapons to keep and which to leave behind. Take Simon on a journey through the nightmarish place that his home city has become, killing monsters, doing drugs, and struggling to survive! Poor Simon... All he wants is to get home.

												Honestly, Cry of Fear is a Powerful game in the ways of horror, the story is interesting to a point, in order to keep you playing. But on the better side the horror element is FANTASTIC!. There is ALOT! of effort into the "Jack in the Box" element and honestly, I can only see myself playing Cry of Fear in parts. I do not want to die from a heart attack (laughs) "ha-ha". But really the best things are.Pros.1) Fantastic!. Jack in the Box horror (jumpscares).2) Intresting story line.3) Good suspense.4) Makes you pray for safety (laughs) "ha-ha".Cons.1) So scary, it makes you play it in parts.2) Graphics.Now the Graphics are not that good, but it was a Modification for Half Life One but i like early two thousend game graphics i grew up with them so it. Does not bother me, I ACTUALLY, PREFER! early two thousend game graphics. But for those that want a fantastic graphical horror game then Silent Hill, Resident Evil, The Forest, Condemned One and Two, Doom III BFG Edition, and many others are the way to go BUT!. If you want a good game with awsome horror and an interesting storyline and if you are man enough, (laughs) "ha-ha" than Cry of Fear is the game for you!.P.S. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
												It's a very good game in general, and as far as horror games go it's the first I was really able to get into, though I'd played Amnesia and Outlast before Cry of Fear. I didn't actually beat either of those, and Cry of Fear is the first I've ever been able to finish aside from maybe Doom 3.Simple "Pros and Cons" Review:Pros:+Free+Impressive graphics for the GoldSource engine, and not really bad looking by any means in my opinion+Pretty good gameplay in general+Excellent atmosphere and soundtrack+Story is decent and I like how most of the monsters or environments can be significant to Simon's condition in general+Starts with a ridiculous jumpscare but still manages to make a lot of people scream in more surprise than anything+Getting jumpscared by some random ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥+Being able to shoot that random ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ in the face with a shotgun until he's dead+Sound design seems adequate+Voice acting is decent and gets the job doneCons:-Can be repetitive-A lot of backtracking, particularly the middle segment. I don't want to spoil much, but there's a big segment in them middle of the game where you have to backtrack through a big, bunch of seperate areas to retrieve fuses to open a door. It just feels like boring, tedious filler and I couldn't even figure out how to get through it or where to go without looking up a walkthrough.-Like I said before, sometimes it can be horribly tedious or vague on where you're supposed to go or what you're supposed to do. For example I spent 15-20 minutes trying to figure out what to do at a segment where you're given a shovel and spots to dig. I dug all the spots following the map and hadn't found a keycard I needed. Did I miss a spot or something? No, apparently not, it was behind a wall nearby, and the shovel and digging is really just to get things like extra ammo.-Sometimes there're too many jumpscares-Sometimes you don't have the ammo to shoot whatever ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ just jumpscared you-Nightmare mode is on steroids and I can't even get past the first guy on Nightmare difficulty, but it's probably possible I think-Co-op seems kinda buggy sometimesI can't really think of much else but all in all I kind of like it, and it's free, so that's even better. You can try it and if you don't like it there's not really much to worry about.

content:
Posted: October 16, 2014
												Cry of Fear is still better than most of it's genre, and it's free. Instead of relying on easy spooks and a lot of gore, CoF delivers horror in moments like being lost in a pitch black cellar when you hear someone starting a chainsaw, or walking in a building that you thought was deserted when you hear quick tapping of footsteps from behind you. The atmosphere is sultry and thick from the beginning, and the fear might not leave you after you've stopped playing.I thought of myself being experienced in horror, but Cry of Fear surprised me positively. It made my skin crawl so badly it hurt, and I'm looking forward to experience it all over again.

content:
Posted: April 27, 2013
												Cry of Fear is a First Person Shooter Survival Horror game and was originally a Half-Life mod, but now it's a standalone game. This game runs on the Goldsource engine and it's amazing how good and detailed the game looks on such an old engine. This game features a huge single-player campaign and a coop campaign as well. With a terrifying atmosphere, twisted monsters and tons of scares, if you love Survival Horror games you can't miss this one out. Since it's free, there's no reason to not give this one at least a try.

content:
Posted: February 17, 2014
												If Cry of Fear doesn't have you on the edge of your seat, who knows, it is possible that another horror game will (but not likely). This game is not the worst horror experience I've ever had, but it is pretty scary! Take on the role of Simon, a depressed man who wakes up in a strange place to discover that there are monsters all over the city! Find new weapons and manage your inventory well, choosing which weapons to keep and which to leave behind. Take Simon on a journey through the nightmarish place that his home city has become, killing monsters, doing drugs, and struggling to survive! Poor Simon... All he wants is to get home.

Posted: June 30, 2014
												This game, is something. I'm going straight into the problems. For one starting a server up for a ♥♥♥♥♥. It kept crashing, we couldn't seem to get it to work nor could we even get into the first menu screen. When it comes to aimming which I have feeling the developers made it like this. But every time you shoot your gun, or use anything else. It completely misses the zombie. I don't know if the developers made it that way, but it gets really annoying after awhile. Now, on to the scares. First of all, let me make this clear. I'm a ♥♥♥♥♥, like a huge ♥♥♥♥ing wuss. Hell, I couldn't even watch a Steven King movie without screaming my head off. So of course I was scared while playing this, even with friends. The fact you have a useless gun that does zero damage doesn't help either. It makes you feel hopeless in ways, and of course scared. Now, going on to the graphics. Do you really need to rip this game? Of course the graphics are bad, BUT the atmosphere is a whole different story. I think a developer should focus more on what is going on around you, then what you see. What I mean by that a game can look ♥♥♥♥♥♥. But if it has a good atmosphere it shouldn't matter. Really graphics shouldn't matter IN THE FIRST PLACE. Anyways, when it comes to the scenery this game does it right. It feels like something demonic has happen, or it makes you feel like you're being watch. And that adds the creepy part to the game, it makes you feel frightened. Anyways, I give this game a 7/10.

content:
Posted: July 28, 2014
												Cry of Fear tells a short but sweet tale of a young man named Simon Henriksson experiencing horrific events as he attempts to traverse through Stockholm, Sweden to get to his home. The plot focuses primarily on Simon's state of mind and his decay due to past events in his life.The gameplay consists of survival-horror mechanics. While guns are an option in the game, ammo can be scarce if the player has a bad trigger-finger. Morphine is used to heal the player, and is just as uncommon as ammo for specific guns. Melee weapons, while effective, do not completely protect the player from harm. The inventory screen does not pause the game, so if the player were to use the inventory system during a hectic fight, they would die if they took too long switching weapons through the menu, hence the quick select option. Saving is done through Tape Recorders, which can be found frequently through chapters. On the hardest difficulty, saving becomes harsher, with the player needing to find a tape to save and can only save 5 times throughout the entire story.There are over 5 different endings in the main game, and many more custom campaigns to play, each having similar characteristics as the horror experienced in the main story. Different modes can be unlocked through replaying the game, along with an assortment of overpowered weapons.There are 30 unlockables in the game, including unlockable modes, custom hoodies for Simon's apparel, and others, each increasing replayability value and can make the game seem a little silly i.e. Simon in Hello Kitty Hoodie.TL;DR Very good game. Play it at least once. Just don't forget about the Book.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 9, 2013
												Когда эту игру выставили на голосование в greenlight я сразу за нее проголосовал, поскольку игра afraid of monsters от тех же разработчиков меня очень порадовала. И cry of fear оправдала ожидания. Главной идеей Cry of Fear является противостояние двух сущностей главного героя, как и в afraid of monsters. Игра предоставляет довольно широкий выбор по концовкам — технически их 6: четыре основные, зависят от выборов в течение игры, одна секретная/шуточная, связанная с Afraid of Monsters, и ещё одна, которую можно получить пройдя кооперативный режим. В целом игра превосходная, вязкая, буквально ощутимая атмосфера депрессии и отчаяния, потрясающие галлюцинации главного героя и невероятно крутой саундтрек. Пожалуй, единственный минус — чрезвычайная скудность настроек графики, впрочем, это не нужно тем, у кого достаточно мощный ПК

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2013
												Well this game should be consider as a hidden gem..Originaly it was HL1 mod but now after year of developing it has become game, not just simple mod and its completely free. Graphics are like from CS 1.6 but much better. Anyway who cares about graphics if you have   awesome atmosphere and sounds :)Cry of Fear contains a single player campaign that claims to take about eight hours time.  The gameplay is like most survival horror games. Atmosphere is great, the dark corridors, the creepy forests to a tight packed school, the environments are varied and have a great way of getting you in the mood and into the game. Another aspect of the atmosphere in sound, Cry of Fear has not only a wonderful soundtrack with scary, dark tracks to beautiful melodies, but the sound in the game. Whether they are foot steps around the corner edging closer or bumping on the walls or a scream in the distance, Cry of Fear definitely full fills the scare factor.Story is simple - game set in a deserted town filled with horrific creatures and nightmarish delusions. You play as a young man desperately searching for answers in the cold Scandinavian night, finding his way through the city as he slowly descends into madness. If you are survival horror fan, you should try this game, maybe you will like it as much as i do.I rate this game very nicely although it has little bit older graphics - 8/10

Posted: July 15, 2016
												It's a free Steam horror game, and has about 8 hours of single player gameplay. It used to be a Half-Life 1 mod, but was released as a standalone.The dated graphics do their job of conveying the creepy atmosphere surprisingly well, and can just be considered as minimal art style today :DI wanted to quit recording, quit some time before I actually ended the video, because I was sucked in the game, and became quite engrossed, always a good sign.At the very start however there is a point where you need to do a crouch-jump, something that won't occur to you if you haven't played other HL1 mods of the era, which I might have, but that's like what? Ten years ago? Anyway, this got me stuck right at the very beginning of the game, always a very bad sign.Cry Of Fear, my first impression video, and walkthrough of approx the first hour:

content:
Posted: December 31, 2016
												Cry of Fear is a surprisingly good, free horror game.Graphics:The graphics aren't great, but they are able to portray a realistic-enough city setting. The game engine's imperfect lighting actually adds a few scares, with textured models popping in over distant silhouettes at unexpected times. The game has some interesting cutscenes that look nice and present the story well.Story:The story is interesting and mysterious. Basically you have an unhappy guy who gets assaulted and knocked out, but when he wakes up he finds that his city has changed completely, or at least there's some supernatural things happening and a lot of people have gone crazy.I got a little burned out by the time I finished chapter 1 of Cry of Fear's story (maybe I just wasn't in the mood for horror lol) but I'm definitely eager to find out what happens next. (I've heard the game has up to 8 chapters, and a couple different endings!)Sound:The voice acting is believable, and the music and sounds are appropriately frightening. The game will sometimes play its tension building music at arbitrary times, and that's actually really effective at getting you to stay on your toes. And since the music buildups don't always result in combat, it actually helps the combat scare you more when you are really ambushed.Gameplay:The movement controls don't feel perfect, but overall that wasn't much of an issue. The combat is intense! Being able to make a quick dodge opens a lot of possibilies, while managing your stamina becomes a careful balance. The gameplay gets somewhat easier once you pick up a gun, but it's a tradeoff because then you always having to worry about conserving ammo (and not reloading too early, because you're essentially throwing away the leftover bullets from that last clip.) You really have to keep an eye out for morphine shots (health packs) because you can get stuck with low health for an awfully long time if you get injured early in the game before you really understand how the combat works.Overall:If you're on a budget, Cry of Fear is a well-rounded free horror game. It's not very polished by today's standards, but it does have some strong elements at its core, and some honest to goodness scares!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
												This game, is something. I'm going straight into the problems. For one starting a server up for a ♥♥♥♥♥. It kept crashing, we couldn't seem to get it to work nor could we even get into the first menu screen. When it comes to aimming which I have feeling the developers made it like this. But every time you shoot your gun, or use anything else. It completely misses the zombie. I don't know if the developers made it that way, but it gets really annoying after awhile. Now, on to the scares. First of all, let me make this clear. I'm a ♥♥♥♥♥, like a huge ♥♥♥♥ing wuss. Hell, I couldn't even watch a Steven King movie without screaming my head off. So of course I was scared while playing this, even with friends. The fact you have a useless gun that does zero damage doesn't help either. It makes you feel hopeless in ways, and of course scared. Now, going on to the graphics. Do you really need to rip this game? Of course the graphics are bad, BUT the atmosphere is a whole different story. I think a developer should focus more on what is going on around you, then what you see. What I mean by that a game can look ♥♥♥♥♥♥. But if it has a good atmosphere it shouldn't matter. Really graphics shouldn't matter IN THE FIRST PLACE. Anyways, when it comes to the scenery this game does it right. It feels like something demonic has happen, or it makes you feel like you're being watch. And that adds the creepy part to the game, it makes you feel frightened. Anyways, I give this game a 7/10.

content:
Posted: August 22, 2014
												Game Reviews #2 Cry of Fear.Apparently this is a mod that took 5 years to make with the old Half Life 1 engine.You are playing as a hoodie who has mental trauma that resulted to his life turn around in a manner of Silent Hill hallucinations and supernatural creatures. For a mod/standalone game that isn't much old [2013 released] it does have it's promise as a good survival horror FPS, There are some jumpscares, fears that you have to run your♥♥♥♥♥good against some enemies you cannot kill then this is the survival horror for you. You can only hold six items much like Chris Redfield from Resident Evil. This game is hard so I'd recommend starting on Easy to get used to how the game plays.I'd give this a 8.3 / 10. This game apparently needs a good gaming PC to Run despite it having the Half Life 1 engine. Which is a bit of BS. Because before I got my Gaming PC. I tried on numerous occasions to get this running on my laptop only to close down itself since it's able to play Half Life 2 games without any lage: but the bright side is that it's a freebie so you can play this game for your own enjoyment without any money spent and it has custom stories too! So you can play other stories besides the main campaign!

												This game is an amazing atmospheric horror-based zombie survival game, but it is so much more. It has a very subtle, intricate backstory with multiple endings to the story itself. content:
Posted: April 11, 2015
												Cry of Fear is simply one of the greatest games I've ever played. I hadn't expected such from a free Steam horror game, but I did play this in it's HL glory days, in which it was still slightly underated. The graphics wern't a problem for me, because the amazing gameplay and atmosphere filled in for what it lacked in graphic quality (it was still surprisingly good for the Half-Life engine). The gameplay absolutly terrified me, making me think that games like The Dark Decent were a walk in the park. Overall, this game is simply 10/10 from me.

content:
Posted: October 16, 2014
												Cry of Fear is still better than most of it's genre, and it's free. Instead of relying on easy spooks and a lot of gore, CoF delivers horror in moments like being lost in a pitch black cellar when you hear someone starting a chainsaw, or walking in a building that you thought was deserted when you hear quick tapping of footsteps from behind you. The atmosphere is sultry and thick from the beginning, and the fear might not leave you after you've stopped playing.I thought of myself being experienced in horror, but Cry of Fear surprised me positively. It made my skin crawl so badly it hurt, and I'm looking forward to experience it all over again.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2013
												If you're a fan of drowning in terror whilst screaming like a little girl at a One Direction concert, this could be the game for you.Of the other comparable horror games I've played, Slender, Amnesia, Dead Space (the good parts), Cry of Fear could possibly be the top of pile, which is all the more impressive given that it's available for free. I also appreciate some of the more unforgiving elements of the game including * enemies that can instantly kill you* enemies that can make you kill yourself* no quick saveI've also tried the co-op play (though just over LAN so far) and found it to be highly entertaining.All things considered this game gets 8 hammers out of 10.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2015
												Probably the scariest game I've ever played that isn't called Silent Hill 3. Unlike other modern horror games, this one uses jump scares very sparingly and instead relies on its environments, sound design and art style to make the player crap their pants, and it succeeds with flying colors. Absolute must play for people who value true horror over cheap jump scares. It also comes loaded with bonus features reminiscient of old survival horror games that add to the replay value. And the best part, it's 100% free to play! Horror fans have no excuse not to pick up this terrifying masterpiece.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 9, 2013
												This is the only horror game that has ever made me feel cold and depressed as well as terrified and alone... I can never forget what i've been through in this amazing game...Now turning into a classic mod and earning the title "mod of the year" for 2 years in a row, this is a horror game that must not be missed out on. (I know I sound like a cheezy buisness man, but it's true...) With an outstanding pace of horror and suspense, you're gaurenteed to be disturbed and terrified. The main things that stood out for me in the game was its unique duelweilding system (holding a gun and a knife, or a knife and a phone being used as a flash light). The incredibly well done atmosphere of the swedish motropolis, the way your moral choices affect multiple endings (7 if I remember correctly) but most importantly, the scares... I will never forget the tricks, traps, and unique ways for the game to endlessly toy with you... most horror games come to a point where you aren't scared anymore. This one actually gets worse the more you play...Don't play if you're suffering from depression. No joke. My friend reffused to talk to anyone for a whole week... It wasn't fun...please excuse spelling, I wrote an essay today and couldn't bring myself to spell check even more :P

content:
Posted: April 20, 2014
												After patching the game for my old computer(a laptop), I finally got this to actually work(crappy computers not advised) so here is the basic list of the game's pros and cons:PROS:- Very clean inventory system- Ability to make your own maps- Different endings(watched these on YouTube)- Multiple weapons and items like flashlights- Very distinct bosses- Disclaimer at the beginning of opening the game up- VERY SCARYCONS:- No players on multiplayer- Not alot of custom maps(maybe download off of ModDB?)- Give's players power, which makes the game less scary.- Some bosses are way too easy to beat(I won't tell you how to beat the first boss).CONCLUSION:Out of all the pros and cons, pros dominated the table and I am proud to call this game a horror game because of its darkness, its grief, and what it means to be in a psychopath's mind is like(Hint Hint).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 20, 2014
												Cry of Fear is an amazing game. The graphics may not be exactly the worlds best, but they are by no means bad. This game makes you feel alone when you need help most, putting your worst nightmares into play. Every monster in the game stands for something in the protagonist's mind. He is a very depressed man. This game is very morbid and twisted. Perhaps the scariest game i have ever played and ever will play. The story is gripping and the gameplay is fun but a tad buggy for co-op, but if you can get co-op to work its not as scary. Although co-op is very fun eitherway. You will scream, with the mix of puzzles and suspense. You will hear your very own, CRY OF FEAR. 4/5PROS:* Great singleplayer and Co-op*Scary and very entertaining* Great Storyline*Gives the feeling of abandonmentCONS:*Not so great gunplay*Glitchy Co-Op*Puzzles can be hard later in the game if your not always having your wits about you

content:
Posted: July 1, 2015
												Probably the scariest game I've ever played that isn't called Silent Hill 3. Unlike other modern horror games, this one uses jump scares very sparingly and instead relies on its environments, sound design and art style to make the player crap their pants, and it succeeds with flying colors. Absolute must play for people who value true horror over cheap jump scares. It also comes loaded with bonus features reminiscient of old survival horror games that add to the replay value. And the best part, it's 100% free to play! Horror fans have no excuse not to pick up this terrifying masterpiece.

Posted: April 5, 2014
												This game is scary for the first few times, and maybe later. Anyways, this game is a fun experience to play. You play as a man named Simon Henrikkson (Dont know how to spell his last name) and he is trying to beat his way to his home, hopefully to escape from the abnormalities that come to kill him. As he goes deeper to the nightmare, he encounters the nightmare stages that actually kill him in reality. Combined with Silent Hill's atmosphere and Resident Evil's limited backpack space, this will provide a real challenge to new players who want a scare.... You have been warned.

												It´s so bad, it´s outright funny.I mean, I know the Game/the mod is really old and so on, so the graphics can´t be criticised by any means,But the "coding" (if you can call it like that) is more "meh", than ok.For example, it´s almost guaranteed to disconnect (while in COOP) when the area is changed, e.g. a door is opened.Also "meh" is the commonly occuring "Glitch-Vision". Posted: April 13, 2015
												I got this game late at night. I played the coop for 2 hours. It was the stupidest coop I ever played, the animations are jank, the enemy designs are laughably generic and difficulty varies rapidly. I loved every second of it.Multiplayer 100/10 Branch is best weapon. I played the first few minutes of the solo campaign and found it was lacking in spooks. Then it tried to jumpscare me with a googly eyed bloody face and I started laughing. I then stopped because I saw it was going to be 'one of those games.'Campaign 1/10 Decent atmosphere but no time for build up. Too fast to be spooks.Overall I give it 5/10 spooky flying beds.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 3, 2014
												While I can't say anything about the Singleplayer (I only got a little ways in and the game crashes on me when I readjust settings so I'm not willing to go past the first jumpscare again) I can say that the gameplay is good and the Cooperative Mode is fun.Without any spoilers, I'll simply say that in the multiplayer campaign you play as up to four police officers trying to survive an onslaught of monsters. The worse (best) part of these campaigns are when you encounter Sawcrazy, a spazzy, monstrous man who uses two chainsaws to run at you. I've been informed that the Singleplayer version of him is much more frightening, which only deepens my fear and prolongs my procrastination of playing it. Ammo seems  to run a little sparse when playing with a lot of other players, which means for some enemies you'll have to get up-close and personal. In the dark. Sometimes alone, as your friends might be dealing with a twisted version of Simon or worse yet, Sawcrazy.Here's something important to note for the coop campaign. You'll probably have to use Hamachi to connect with anyone, since the CoF team never seemed to fix the server listings. I had to look up Cry of Fear servers just to find a forum post on Steam with someone who wanted to play with others (lucky me).Don't mistake this as being an indication the game is bad, though. It's frightening, sure, but that's exactly the point in a horror game. There are only a few minor problems to worry about, such as crashing after applying settings, but these aren't really problems after you're all set up. This is a great game and best of all it's FREE, so there's no excuse for any horror-lover not to download it and get started right away.The graphics aren't so amazing your eyes will pop out, but they're definitely decent. In truth, the fact that these monsters are slightly lower-textured than modern games just makes them that much creepier.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
												First look : "wow ! for something using the half life 1 engine, this is quite an impressive work !"First jumpscare : "oh that spooked me ! oh well... a bit cheap though, let's see where this is going"First steps in : "wow... that atmospher is... terribly perfect !"First gameplay combat system : "now THAT's what a survival horror is supposed to be : few ammo, aggressive ennemy, easily hit..."A bit later : "I sweating on my chair like I was in a hammam ! It's been some times since I've been this scared !"And further and further in the game : "wait... this is still the Half life 1 engine ?!"... "wait.. this is still an indie game ?!"Coming to the ending : "the guys who made this are definitly genius !"Story excellent, gameplay excellent, atmospher wonderfully dark, level design amazing even if some levels are recycled, cinematics good enough, voice acting could have been better sometimes (but oh well !), music beautiful.All those things proves the team do better than making a mod. They knows how to make a game. And all of that for free ! Seriously, you got no excuse for not testing this masterpiece of horror gaming, except if you can't handle the pressure of the clostrophobic event this game offers (and "offers" is a the best word here).Congratulation to Psyskallar ! I want more now ! Have my money ! you deserved it !

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 9, 2013
												This is the only horror game that has ever made me feel cold and depressed as well as terrified and alone... I can never forget what i've been through in this amazing game...Now turning into a classic mod and earning the title "mod of the year" for 2 years in a row, this is a horror game that must not be missed out on. (I know I sound like a cheezy buisness man, but it's true...) With an outstanding pace of horror and suspense, you're gaurenteed to be disturbed and terrified. The main things that stood out for me in the game was its unique duelweilding system (holding a gun and a knife, or a knife and a phone being used as a flash light). The incredibly well done atmosphere of the swedish motropolis, the way your moral choices affect multiple endings (7 if I remember correctly) but most importantly, the scares... I will never forget the tricks, traps, and unique ways for the game to endlessly toy with you... most horror games come to a point where you aren't scared anymore. This one actually gets worse the more you play...Don't play if you're suffering from depression. No joke. My friend reffused to talk to anyone for a whole week... It wasn't fun...please excuse spelling, I wrote an essay today and couldn't bring myself to spell check even more :P

												It´s so bad, it´s outright funny.I mean, I know the Game/the mod is really old and so on, so the graphics can´t be criticised by any means,But the "coding" (if you can call it like that) is more "meh", than ok.For example, it´s almost guaranteed to disconnect (while in COOP) when the area is changed, e.g. a door is opened.Also "meh" is the commonly occuring "Glitch-Vision". It means that no obstacles are shown, just enemies, ammo, doors and the basic path, no walls, no trees, no cars or anything.If you download it, check the Wikia before, it´s good to understand the whole story of that thing (which is pretty nice actually).I´d recommend playing with a friend (or more), to enhance the experience (or to come up with better jokes).It´s not all bad, it´s more like extremely "meh".
