number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 3, 2014
												While I can't say anything about the Singleplayer (I only got a little ways in and the game crashes on me when I readjust settings so I'm not willing to go past the first jumpscare again) I can say that the gameplay is good and the Cooperative Mode is fun.Without any spoilers, I'll simply say that in the multiplayer campaign you play as up to four police officers trying to survive an onslaught of monsters. The worse (best) part of these campaigns are when you encounter Sawcrazy, a spazzy, monstrous man who uses two chainsaws to run at you. I've been informed that the Singleplayer version of him is much more frightening, which only deepens my fear and prolongs my procrastination of playing it. Ammo seems  to run a little sparse when playing with a lot of other players, which means for some enemies you'll have to get up-close and personal. In the dark. Sometimes alone, as your friends might be dealing with a twisted version of Simon or worse yet, Sawcrazy.Here's something important to note for the coop campaign. You'll probably have to use Hamachi to connect with anyone, since the CoF team never seemed to fix the server listings. I had to look up Cry of Fear servers just to find a forum post on Steam with someone who wanted to play with others (lucky me).Don't mistake this as being an indication the game is bad, though. It's frightening, sure, but that's exactly the point in a horror game. There are only a few minor problems to worry about, such as crashing after applying settings, but these aren't really problems after you're all set up. This is a great game and best of all it's FREE, so there's no excuse for any horror-lover not to download it and get started right away.The graphics aren't so amazing your eyes will pop out, but they're definitely decent. In truth, the fact that these monsters are slightly lower-textured than modern games just makes them that much creepier.

content:
Posted: March 18, 2015
												FIRST IMPRESSION: -Graphics     This game does not boast particularly impressive graphics, but with a game like this it does not particularly matter. So do not let that be a deterrent for you. The game features some repeating textures and a lot of repeated AI animation (As in AI number 1 will always die with animation number 1). While something like that would usually deter me from a game I found no problem overlooking it as this game features many different types of AI and level types.-Audio     The audio roughly matches the graphics quality, particularly with AI (as in AI number 1 will always attack with sound number 1). As for the raw audio quality it is no masterpiece but it more than gets the job done and definitely adds to the sense of immersion.-Controls     I will admit that when I first started playing this game that I had some difficulty getting started with the GUI for things like the player inventory. There is no tutorial but as long as you're willing to spend five minutes casually learning the menu controls you will be fine. As for the actual gameplay controls I have no complaints, it's easy to navigate and you go where you think you'll go when you press a directional button. For the most part it's very natural.THE GAME:     This is one of my favorite games of all time. The story is immersive and sticks with you when you leave the game. While it's not a mystery game it will definitely hook you into trying to figure out what is going on. This game has caused me to jump more than once and can definitely invoke a sense of fear. That stacked on top of its twisted, dark storyline and anatomically distorted AI make it highly memorable. The game takes much more than 10 hours to beat with its mazes, combat and puzzles.Pros:-Scary-Immersive storyline-Vast array diverse of maps-Puzzles that are just the right amount of hard-1st person (Best for this type of game)-Longer game-Good amount of very original AI-FREENeutral:-Lack of tutorial (Good for immersiveness)-Almost zero instruction (Good for immersiveness)Cons:-Repetitive AI sounds (though this really won't affect you much)-Saves are non-transferable*SUMMARY:     Really you can't go wrong with this game. It is fun and free so you might as well give it a shot!SCORE:  For what it is and how much it costs  9/10  *You cannot pull saves for this game and use them in another installation, so plan to beat it before you replace your HDD

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
Pros:- Amazing graphics despite being done with the ( modified ) Half-Life engine - I've never thought it could do water reflections, specular bump-mapping, post-processing effects and rain ( never seen rain in the original Half-Life ).- Jumpscares, although being used a lot, come with a lot of variants so I don't get tired of them. You'll never know what is waiting at the next corner.- Sound and music design are quite good. There are a few silent sections, which I believe the developers did it on purpose. Like Akira Yamaoka said: "Silence is also a sound."- Tons of extra unlockables and custom campaigns after beating the main game, and even the single player alone is more than enough for a free game ( +/- 8 hours ).Cons:- The limited inventory system can sometimes get a bit hilarious. For example, a key and a spade takes up the same amount of storage ( 1 slot ).- Sawrunner spots are quite predictable thanks to these save points. ( could fix this by implementing an auto-save system which saves game in the background without noticing the player about it ).- Frustrating backtrack sections.- Puzzles are irrelevant to the story being told. The same to item placements ( who the hell put ammo in the bus anyway? )- Obstacles seem obvious to bypass, can't be bypassed.Overall, this is a great Silent Hill/Penumbra hybrid and any horror fan must have it. And it's free.

content:
Posted: August 15, 2015
												This is a serious review so there isn't anything witty or funny I have played this game all the way and I can say that this is a top teir horror/single-player game.The first reason why i love this game is because it's the perfect amount of horror and suspense that makes this game one of my favorites. Like most of the horror games in 2015, they mainly focus on jumpscares and nothing else. This game, however, helps create a suspensefull story that you'll want to never end. Though this game has jumpscares in it, the game doesn't use it an excessive amount to here you don't want to play the game anymore.The other reason why i love this game is because of the story (NO SPOILERS). What happened? Why are there monsters everywhere that want to kill me? Who is this doctor guy? Why was I hit by a car and who was it that hit me? All these questions but no answers. This story makes you want to stay at your computer all day and play this game (like we always do with our games anyway). As well, the story keeps unraveling more and more as you play the game and at the end you finally get to see what the hell is going on.Though the game does have some glitches and bugs, most of them can be fixed through a couple of patches thanks to the developer.AND THE GAME IS FREE!!! A game with half the story as this is worth $60 but this game is absolutely free to play which is amazing.I hope this helped :)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 30, 2016
												Cry of Fear is possibly the best free indie horror game I've ever played and it still holds up almost half a decade from it's initial release. The game is set in central Sweden, which makes for some very beautiful, yet dark and gritty scenery. The ammount of diffrent enemies in this game is crazy and their designs will be sure to give you plenty of nightmares. For those who didn't know, Cry of Fear was originally a mod for the original Half-Life, but then it became it's own standalone game here on Steam. To see what the developers have done with such an old game engine is absolutely astonishing. Those who don't like this game usually critique it for it's clunky combat, excessive backtracking, and overdone jumpscares. What most people are forgetting is that this game is absolutely free and it's way better than most of the Untiy garbage we have here on Steam today.

content:
Posted: November 20, 2016
												This may be the longest review ill be writing, even then it may still be short.From what i gather this is made in the source engine like the ohter halflife mod games, One of the biggest things ive noticed sinced ive played other games like that is: you dont need to own Half life 1 or two all the textures in this game work phenomily well, I remember playing no more room in hell and because i was missing textures they would appear in purple with this game there is none of that.Pros-Free to play means that there is micro transactions to it this is a absoluelty  free game-For a Free game the atmosphere is honestly amazing it spooks me, not like jump scare once and a while but a actually feeling of horror around every bend going into every door, the music is fantastic and so are the ambient horror noises that happen through the game-From what ive seen in what ive played the enemy design is so well done, very silent hill style but a bit more...disturbing-Being only two hours in it seems to have a pretty nice story line but i havent seen the full scope of the things to come and i may update it once i complete itCons-My biggest problem is the controls, there is some obsticles that once you get to it you have to play with the control and jump just to get through, but i can see that easily being fixed no problem, they may have just over done it with the box collider size-This is just a personal thing, i would have loved to have seen a limited ammount of saves thing just like RE had back in the day, I really loved that concept then and would have worked well in my opinion in this game to-Besides these two minor things this game is amazingOther thoughtsin this game im always at the edge of my seat with my heart pumping, Having been a huge fan of every RE game for the past almost 2 decades and silent hill, NONE of the there newer stuff has made me feel the way this game makes me feel, besides that i cant think of the last game that actually did make me feel me being scared all the way while playing it, these dev team clearly hit the nail on the head with a sledge hammer on this game and the fact its free its honestly unbelievable. I recommend this game to honestly anyone who loves these style of games as it is exremily unique and very well done.10/10 for meTl;Dr If you dont own this game download it, its free and phenomenal.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2015
												Cry of fear is both a exciting and terrifying experience! I only saw the menus but BOY was I on the edge of my seat the entire time! Was it going to work?! Was it going to crash on me again?! WHO KNOWS! Man thats exciting! But you want to know what the most terrifying part of the whole thing was? When you tried to join a co-op game... It's almost to frightning to talk about... when you tried to load up a co-op game and the game froze for just a second. I swear your entire life flashed before your eyes wondering if its going to crash or work! but I will say this! The game has great replayablility, When the game crashes, you gotta re-load it and experience it all over again! Its a diffrent out come everytime!All in all I gotta be fair with this game! 9/10 would recommend!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 5, 2015
												Cry Of Fear does one thing and it does it extremly well. It builds tension. The best part is that it dose this in a way no other horror genre game has done to date. Most atmospheric horor games build tension by letting your brain do a lot of the work. They place you in uneasy environments and don't rely on jump scares. Games like Silent Hill and Amnesia immediately spring to mind.Cry of Fear is too good for that old way. They took the novel approach of building tension by making it phycologicly draining to even play the game. It took 50 minutes of menu clicking and server setting up to even start to think about launching the actual game. All the while your brain is churning and building that tension "will this game be worth the pain?" "What horrors could this agonizing process result in?"The answer is that you will not be able to set up a server and the game will crash. The scary bit was you just wasted an hour of your life... NOTHING is free

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												I highly recommend this game for anyone who likes first-person shooter games, freaky creature attacks, playing with friends, being creeped out of your socks, and a single-player storyline campaign.I have 30 hours of game time so far, and I will most definately continue to play this game! I absolutely love the co-op mode. I've recorded multiple videos of me and my friends playing together going through waves of monsters with just tree branches and each other. The gameplay can be VERY challenging, such as when you run out of ammo in all of your guns and you get assulted by a chainsaw-slinging maniac! But it is also interesting, for example- the terrain switches up throughout gameplay from a village, to a sewer, to a maze/house, to a lake. It gets pretty insane!The graphics are smooth and detailed. So it can work well enough on an average computer, and if your computer is a little above average, it looks fantastic for a free game. I haven't tried out the single-player campaign so far, but I'm expecting no less than I'm getting from co-op mode. Definately worth 5 GB of memory : )EDIT: I've played a bit of the campaign now, and... It's an entirely different experience that the co-op! My nerves are constantly on edge as I walk around each street curb, and get ambushed by bloody creatures. Worth it!P.S.- Please click on the link below and check out my YouTube channel. I REALLY enjoy recording and want to entertain anyone who enjoys what I do, so please spread the word by sharing my channel with your friends and family, and telling them to spread my channel. Thank you so much! : )                                      Link:

content:
Posted: February 18, 2016
												If you can get past the dodgy voice acting, outdated graphics, silly Swedish accents, occasional (unintentionally) funny moments, and sometimes annoying gameplay, Cry of Fear does have quite a bit to offer, especially compared to its competitors in the free-to=play horror category.Being both a sufferer of depression and psychosis, as well as a long-term addict fan of horror games, it was somewhat of a comfort to see a title that revolved around such issues, as opposed to purely around an external conflict. (Instead of simply being at odds with monsters, you're also at odds with yourself.) That said, the story is fairly unique in that way, and is probably what kept me interested in playing the game despite its many shortcomings.Above all however, I have to praise this game for its skillfully-crafted depressive atmosphere and subtle ways in which it makes Simon's (the protagonist) character relatable. The most memorable examples of this were seeing self-harm scars on his arms whenever he rolled up his sleeve to expend a syringe, or being visually bombarded with posters and flyers for depression treatment regimens. It was that sort of thing that made me instantly identify with him, and it was charming in a way I haven't seen many other games pull off.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2013
												Cry of Fear was an audacious Half-Life 1 mod that turned into a full fledged game for release on Steam about a year after the release. In short, this game is great. This game contains a gripping story of a young man named Simon who is lost in himself and struggling to survive when monsters appear. Cry of Fear contains a single player campaign that claims to take about eight hours time, but for my first playthrough I was about 12-16 hours of gametime. The gameplay is like most survival horror games, but you are limited, you don't have a briefcase like Resident Evil 4. you do have a backpack and your pockets but you cannot carry everything, forcing you to make sacrifices on what you want to carry and what you NEED to carry, this aspect helps produce more tension when trying to figure out, should I keep this gun even though I have one clip? Or take the melee weapon and key and continue on? The controls work well, and it's not clunky or difficult, except one section of the game which required platforming and was my sole problem with the game.Cry of Fear's atmosphere is great, the dark corridors, the creepy forests to a tight packed school, the environments are varied and have a great way of getting you in the mood and into the game. Another aspect of the atmosphere in sound, Cry of Fear has not only a wonderful soundtrack with scary, dark tracks to beautiful melodies, but the sound in the game. Whether they are foot steps around the corner edging closer or bumping on the walls or a scream in the distance, Cry of Fear definitely full fills the scare factor.On the topic of features, Cry of Fear has a good lengthed single player campaign, not like a Slender game that takes about 20-40 minutes, this game takes hours. There is also another secret campaign after beating the first, then a completely separate co-op campaign, and multiple custom campaigns along with a custom campaign and map creator that is intuitive and easy to use. Not to mention Cry of Fear's "Suicide Mode" which is basically survival, you kill enemies to decrease the amount of time on the clock to reach zero and survive, it's difficult, but fun and you can do it with friends.All in all, Cry of Fear is an amazing package, you get so much content and a wondrous game that was made very well for such a small team, Team Psykskallar did a great job, and did I mention this game is absolutely free on Steam? Go play and have fun! 9/10

Posted: September 26, 2013
												Cry of fear has a lot of problems, primarily in the design department. You have a bunch of great assets, and some improvements to the engine to make a creepy game, but in the end it's just a bunch of hallways, locked doors, and no direction. Most of the time will be spent getting frustrated by the maze of hallways that all look the same, and it will kill your motivation to continue. I think this game could have been something far better than it was if the developers had just spent more time getting it properly tested and polished. There is a lot of potential here, but it was sadly wasted.

			This game is available here: http://store.steampowered.com/app/223710 A non-biased quick look @ 'Cry of Fear' - Cry of Fear originally started out as a Half-Life 1 modification, set in the same vein...		

This is how you make a really good half life horror mod.Cry of Fear originally started out as a Half-Life 1 modification, set in the same vein as the classic survival horror games of old. 4 years in the making and picking up several modding awards on the way, it is now a free, standalone game for anyone to enjoy. Beware though, it's not for the faint of heart. Cry of Fear is a psychological single-player and co-op horror game set in a deserted town filled with horrific creatures and nightmarish delusions. You play as a young man desperately searching for answers in the cold Scandinavian night, finding his way through the city as he slowly descends into madness. With a strong emphasis on cinematic experience, immersion and lateral thinking, players will be taken on a nightmare rollercoaster-ride through the grim streets of Fäversholm and beyond. Recommended!

content:
Posted: June 27, 2013
												The second mod of the swedish developer Andreas Rönnberg for Half-Life 1 (published in 1998) is definitely the largest and most impressive mod that I've ever played. Despite rather outdated graphics and animations - based on the Gold Source engine - the game succeeded to fascinate me by presenting survival horror with unreal-appearing elements in a way that you often question yourself whether the happening is real, a dream or even something else. In addition to the main story there are also several campaigns that have been created by outside developers, of which the game by default already contains some. A co-op mode with its own campaign and a survival mode ensure fun with up to four players! Because the mod can be downloaded for free on Steam and even Half-Life 1 is no longer needed to play it, I can only recommend to check this fantastic mod out!┴┬ German Translation ┬┴Die zweite Mod des schwedischen Entwicklers Andreas Rönnberg für das 1998 erschienene Spiel Half-Life 1 ist definitiv die größte und beeindruckenste Mod, die ich jemals gespielt habe. Trotz eher veralteter Grafiken und Animationen - basierend auf der Gold-Source-Engine - gelang es dem Spiel mich in den Bann zu ziehen, indem es Survival-Horror mit irreal-erscheinenden Elementen so präsentiert, dass man sich selbst desöfteren die Frage stellt, ob das Geschehen die Realität, ein Traum oder sogar etwas anderes ist. Neben der Haupthandlung sind zudem mehrere Kampagnen von außenstehenden Entwicklern kreiert worden, von denen das Spiel standardmäßig bereits einige beinhaltet. Ein Co-op-Modus mit eigener Kampagne und ein Survival-Modus sorgen für Spielspaß mit bis zu vier Spielern! Da die Mod kostenlos bei Steam heruntergeladen werden kann und selbst Half-Life 1 nicht mehr benötigt wird, kann ich nur empfehlen diese fantastische Mod selbst anzutesten!

												Cry of Fear was an audacious Half-Life 1 mod that turned into a full fledged game for release on Steam about a year after the release. In short, this game is great. This game contains a gripping story of a young man named Simon who is lost in himself and struggling to survive when monsters appear. Cry of Fear contains a single player campaign that claims to take about eight hours time, but for my first playthrough I was about 12-16 hours of gametime. The gameplay is like most survival horror games, but you are limited, you don't have a briefcase like Resident Evil 4. you do have a backpack and your pockets but you cannot carry everything, forcing you to make sacrifices on what you want to carry and what you NEED to carry, this aspect helps produce more tension when trying to figure out, should I keep this gun even though I have one clip? Or take the melee weapon and key and continue on? Another aspect of the atmosphere in sound, Cry of Fear has not only a wonderful soundtrack with scary, dark tracks to beautiful melodies, but the sound in the game. Whether they are foot steps around the corner edging closer or bumping on the walls or a scream in the distance, Cry of Fear definitely full fills the scare factor.On the topic of features, Cry of Fear has a good lengthed single player campaign, not like a Slender game that takes about 20-40 minutes, this game takes hours. There is also another secret campaign after beating the first, then a completely separate co-op campaign, and multiple custom campaigns along with a custom campaign and map creator that is intuitive and easy to use. Not to mention Cry of Fear's "Suicide Mode" which is basically survival, you kill enemies to decrease the amount of time on the clock to reach zero and survive, it's difficult, but fun and you can do it with friends.All in all, Cry of Fear is an amazing package, you get so much content and a wondrous game that was made very well for such a small team, Team Psykskallar did a great job, and did I mention this game is absolutely free on Steam? Go play and have fun! 9/10

content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												A mod-gone-indie Horror game. Absolutely free, and absolutely terrifying.Single Player isn't that bad; The combat is awkward and a lot of the scares are "cheap shots" that rely on jump scares but ultimately, it gets the job done. Storywise, well... look elsewhere.Coop is a bit shallow; Isn't very long and loses a bit of the scare factor once you realise that everyone around you is there to help, somewhat dimnishing the horror effect, and the awkward combat makes coop more of a hilarity than a frightfest.All in all, a pretty good scare for a whopping $0.00. Try it out if you're curious, what do you have to lose?

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 20, 2016
												You play as a depressed, self-harming boy named Simon, who goes through a variety of locations where both his physical stamina and mental stability are put to the test as he tries to return home. As you progress through the game, you begin to realize how the sheer insanity of the enemies actually reflect on Simon's very thoughts and emotions.You have to go through this game assuming that something is going to pop out at you from where you are trying to go, or break down the door that you're directly in front of. This means that to progress, you will either need quick reflexes from the start, or you will have to employ trial and error very frequently.There are a few issues in this game, one being that if you open a note that you stored, or even sometimes when you are reading the map in the park, the game will get stuck on it, and you will be forced to reload the most recent game save to escape the screen. Additionally, the collision experienced here is almost game-breaking; there were several instances where it took 20+ minutes in one location because of awkward placement of objects and/or enemies. The absolute darkness and apparently broken gamma/brightness adjustment controls also had me navigating through moving along walls for most of the game, especially underwater.I recommend playing this game on "Easy" difficulty on your first playthrough if you don't want to get incredibly ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off, as I played it on "Normal" and I'm genuinely surprised that I beat this game. There are little provisions for ammo and health, but when there are, they will either easily be overlooked because of their placement in seemingly insignificant locations, or they will be placed in plain sight, but only because you are about to REALLY need them.The horror of the game itself was initially frightening, but only because it was unfamiliar. The jump-scares of the game quickly changed from shocking to annoying, as the same scares repeated themselves over and over and over again. The appearance of the enemies along with the general atmosphere of the game was more creepy than it was scary, but it did have a nice effect on the tensions in the game.Why do I recommend this game?: Only because the storyline and the existence of the enemies have a very intriguing and surprising correlation, which you slowly find out as you progress through the game. Cry of Fear is full of jump-scares, but it is also full of cheap, unfair, and broken mechanics that make higher difficulties mind-numbingly frustrating.Playability: 3/10Story Quality: 8/10Difficulty: 10/10Intensity of Horror: 5/10

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 13, 2013
												I played this one in its pre-Steam days, and must say I was MOSTLY very, very impressed.  MOSTLY.  Now lemme tell you why (prepare for the obligatory rant)...   SAVE AND CHECKPOINTING SYSTEMS.  Yeah, I'm gonna go on about those...AGAIN.  But I really do live in a world full of hope...the hope that one day, game designers (both "amateur" and "professional") might realise that NOT ALL PEOPLE WHO ENJOY GAMES SPEND THEIR ENTIRE LIVES PLAYING THEM.  We semi-committed gamers, for instance, certainly seek a CHALLENGE when we play games...but we don't enjoy it when a game chooses to be so stubbornly, pig-headedly "hard" that we feel like THROWING OUR LAPTOPS OUT THE ♥♥♥♥ING WINDOW.  If you're going to put in insanely tricky bits of jumping, rendered three times harder still by surreal, otherworldly physics which don't quite translate when the graphics are a tad on the "low-res" side, please...PLEASE...put one or two checkpoints along the way so we don't have to do those first five finicky jumps EIGHTY-SEVEN ♥♥♥♥ING TIMES before we master that one jump that we can't quite get our stupid heads around.  And that oh-so-clever bit of uber-jumping up the crashed train car before it drops off the cliff?  Don't make me do that first combination of walk-forward/jump-up/turn-left/crouch-jump/two-steps-forward/turn-right/jump-WITHOUT-crouch-or-you'll-hit-your-head-and-fall-back-down/forward-one-step-and-one-step-only/etc etc etc OVER AND OVER AGAIN, without a single save or checkpoint along the way...please?!?  Though I really did love that final touch where I finally, after Lord-knows how many attempts, made it to the top, and what happens?  I turned the WRONG WAY (it was a fifty-fifty chance) once safely out of the train car, and somehow still managed to go plummeting to my death for the NINETY-SIXTH TIME!!!   This♥♥♥♥♥♥is not fun, kids.  It's just anger-inducing.  And plain-old INSULTING to people who've already invested a number of hours into your otherwise rather excellent and refreshingly JUMPING-FREE game.  Two more things on this subject:  One, all games need to have a "natural"-seeming learning curve, where if you're going to do something like a pedantically-difficult jumping bit, it needs to be PRECEDED by similar-though-not-quite-as-hard bits which prepare the player for what is to come.  That's just sound GAME DESIGN.  Secondly...pedantically-difficult jumping bits really don't even WORK in a FIRST-PERSON GAME.  The first-person view just isn't suited to it.  If you wanna make a platform game, please make it in THIRD-person.  But enough of the incensed ranting, and on with the good stuff...   Cry Of Fear is one of the scariest games you will ever play, and one of the best first-person games you will probably ever play, period.  It's chock-full of great ideas.  A few silly ones, granted, and a♥♥♥♥♥♥tonne of rather derivative ones...but if you've ever wanted to know what the early Silent Hill games would have been like in single-person, you couldn't do much better than this.  SO many well-calculated scares, a likeable and intriguing if not entirely "logical" plot, suitably loony voice-acting and...well, just so much for a dyed-in-the-wool horror fan to love.  Which is maybe not surprising, considering what a labour of love this game/mod clearly was.  Just a wee bit of game-testing OUTSIDE of the hardcore, played-it-all-before, this-is-my-four-hundred-and-twenty-fifth-first-person-shooter-and-I-can-play-Half-Life-1-through-in-under-two-hours-with-one-hand-tied-behind-my-back crowd...and we could'a had a very nearly PERFECT game experience here.    I so very nearly love it, but I don't know when I'll muster up the courage to play it again...NOT because of how♥♥♥♥♥♥your-pants-scary it so often is, but because I really, really, REALLY don't want to ever have to do those two aforementioned ♥♥♥♥♥♥ jumping bits EVER AGAIN.  IN MY ENTIRE LIFE.  But I probably will...which is testament, surely, to how good the REST of the game truly is (okay, there's a few other crappy bits too, but those two truly take the cake).  Can't wait 'til these guys make a "real" (read: commercially-produced) game, with someone else's money, and all the quality control which (regrettably) only seems to come with that level of corporate overlording.  GETTING PEWDIEPIE TO GAME-TEST YOUR PRODUCT IS NOT THE WAY TO CREATE A WIDELY-ACCESSIBLE, UNIVERSALLY-PLAYABLE PRODUCT!!!  Find some people with full-time jobs, and see if THEY can get through your bloody game!!!!!!PS  I haven't yet played this one on Steam, so if the above ranting about lack of save/checkpoints is now null and void, I profusely apologise.  Having said that, I haven't seen any pigs flying outside my window tonight, so I'm kinda doubting such a miracle has taken place.  But again...WORLD FULL OF HOPE.  And really nasty, ♥♥♥♥ed-in-the-head horror games.  That's the world I wanna live in.Verdict: 9/10.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 24, 2014
												Cry of Fear is a Psychological First Person Shooter Survival Horror taking place in Stockholm (Fäversholm ingame), Sweden.Cry of Fear is my 2nd favorite game of all time. It only gets beaten by S.T.A.L.K.E.R. I love Cry of Fear so much because of the atmosphere, the sick and twisted horror or it might be because, and I can assure you that, it is the best survival horror I ever played. The atmosphere is one of the best ever accomplished in a video game. It´s depressing, oppressing, evil and also obscure and something very unique. It made me paranoid for a while. The story is simple but good. Simon, depressed, full of emotional problems is getting in an car accident, which changes everything. He is also having problems of confessing his feelings for his crush. If you could throw ♥♥♥♥ at someone, everyone would throw it at Simon. Result: suicidal and homicidal thoughts. He gets in treatment, but the therapy backfires terribly and makes the unstable mind of Simon Erikkson a ticking timebomb. As you can see a topic not everyone likes, that´s why not everyone really liked playing this game. You really have to try it out and give it a chance. It´s based on the GoldSrc engine on which also Half Life 1 was running on. Team Psykskallar really made the best out of this old engine and you can clearly see it. Graphics are decent. Whats left? Ah, horror and gameplay. You have a big variety of levels, from the typical subway station to the mental hospital and forest but also parks and sewers, subway maintenace bays, construction sites and apartements, a school, a very nice boat scene and more!You have an inventory system like resident evil. You have to carefully pick and manage your equipment. It´s kept more simple though. Weapon models are excellent, as are the animations and the sound design overall. Close Combat is clunky at the beginning but gets better and very smooth and satisfying after some time. Usually after the apartements, as soon as you get your first gun, that should be after 40 mins. You have to create your own technique of slash and dodge to succesfully kill your opponent. Dodging is purely accomplished by excerising it. Ammo for guns can be scarce on normal and hard, not on easy. You need then to switch to your Close Combat wepons such as knives, batong, fists, etc.There are different endings and choices to be made, if I remember correctly, you have two choices which give you 4 main story endings. 1 co-op ending, 1 secret and 1 manhunt campaign ending.The game is about 10 hrs for beginners and 8 for faster people and can be beaten in 2,5 hrs by pros.Now to the horror. If you played Amnesia or Slender and you felt it was a walk in the park, then this game is nothing for you. It´s between Amnesia and Resident Evil with a touch Silent Hill. It has some cheap jumpscares, but only about 15% are cheap ones, the rest are unpredictable and just plain evil and scary as hell and you always have a feeling of being followed. The paranoia I mentioned, usually comes up in the silent parts. The soundtrack is one of the best in video games history, fitting perfectly to the game, making it effective to build tension and weird feelings at the right moments. If you are a very emotional person, you will love it. If you are a cold brick, better go back and play your casual games. Some puzzles can be frustrating and many parts can be hard to accomplish or are just tearing apart your brain (maze). First time playing it, is hard, but after you solved them, it´s really satisfying and rewarding. The overall feeling after finishing the game is fantastic. It makes you feel accomplishment, something very rare these days. And don´t call Simon an Emo or I come and eat your eyeballs.For me it´s a 10/10. A fair unbiased rating would be a 7/10. It has it´s problems but how I like to say: Somebody who can´t be patient and endure a few grinding moments, also can´t enjoy the joy of accomplishment and nostalgia.

Posted: April 5, 2016
												I don't even know where to start with this. The idea was very cool, playing a police officer in a horror game is an awesome idea! This just was not done right at all. I felt as if the story was very boring, and sometimes, not even "scary." I played the cooperative mode with a friend of mine, and if you die, you lose ALL items. Yup, if you die then have fun trying to kill dual-wielding chainsaw peep with um... a stick.The game could have been better, I understand it's on the old Source engine, but that's no excuse for such a poor executed development. On the bright side, it's free to play! Anyways, game does not live up to the standards of Silent Hill, or even Layers of Fear. I would rate this game, probably below average, a big 3/10.

number of helpful: 11 of 21 people (52%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 10, 2016
												Not sure how the heck this game has 84% positive reviews its a total waste of memory space. In the short moments I attempted to play it I discovered this: its unplayable.First of all on intial launch of the game through steam your presented with this very small window with a few options to click on. From this small screen you have to then click another button that says "Launch" to actually start the game. While this isnt a big deal its kind of an annoying setup.Second the game crashes allot and doesn't save settings. I had my game crash 3-4 times just trying to join the server my boyfriend had set up for us to test out this game. As far as the settings issue goes I nearly got my ears blasted out from the volume of this game. So naturally I yank off my headset and go to look for the volume settings. Turned the volume way down and clicked apply assuming that it had worked. Closed out of the options menu and went to look for the join server button again. Of course my game crashes again so I re-launched it and once again almost got my ears blasted out because of the 2 part launch setup. Once I actually got into the game I realized it hadn't saved my volume settings. I went to change them again and after exiting the settings menu now the main menu structure is all screwed up.This brings me to my third issue with this game the menu structure. When the game is first launched the main menu looks like any other typical menu you'd see in a co-op style game. However once you actually click on anything the menu changes and it is very difficult to get back to the original menu as there seems to be no obvious "back" or "previous" button anywhere on screen. That for me was strike number three and after having all these issues when the game crashed for a fourth time I gave up and uninstalled the game.If you really wanna play a game like this thats free and based off of half-life try sven co-op. Its not as creepy but at least its freaking playable.

content:
Posted: April 28, 2013
												Cry of Fear is one of the most ambitious mods I’ve ever played. Four years in the making with a small team of three Half Life fans, and I couldn’t be happier with the result.Essentially it’s a narrative horror game complete with jump scares, survival elements, and just genuinely terrifying horror that keeps you on the edge of your seat. What surprised me the most about Cry of Fear is the fact that it’s been built using the GoldSource engine, which to say the least, is ancient. The developers have worked so hard to create all their own custom content and enhance the engine in so many ways. Soft shadows, particle effects, the game looks really good compared to older generation games that used it. Gameplay elements such as animated ladder climbing, sprinting, true ADS and a bunch of other cool features, have given the engine a more modern feel. They’ve even added cutscenes that lend well to the story.In addition to the main story and unlocks, there’s also several custom campaigns that have been included with the standalone release. Some of these were made by the developers, but most are made by other modders who share the same passion for Cry of Fear. I’ve only played a couple so far, but they’re really fun and give people something to do after finishing the main campaign. There’s also a 4 player co-op feature, but it isn’t up and running yet so I’ll hold off on saying anything good or bad about it.Despite the old engine, the game is still very very scary. Before the mod was released last year, I didn’t think that something made using the GoldSource engine could even remotely scare me. Well Cry of Fear proved me wrong. The sound effects, pacing of the game, and even the subtle jump scares all create this sense of dread as you move through the mostly dark levels. Plus the enemy models creep me out! I love the soundtrack which has been mostly composed by the mod team leader. The songs really add to the tension of the game and I really get into it while I’m playing :P Now for some of the not so good things. The menu seems quite glitchy at times and I don’t like the voice actors at all. In particular, the main character *sigh*. He just doesn’t speak enough English to properly convey the emotional journey of the character and his descent into madness. I found it a hard time believing anything he said. I certainly couldn’t take him seriously (especially when he swore). But these are small concerns for an otherwise amazing horror game.  Now that this standalone version has been released, a lot more people can finally enjoy this horror adventure and I’m very happy with the end result.

content:
Posted: October 14, 2015
												Get a friend and get ready for some cheap spooks!No, but really, this game is broken, glitchy, weird, with bad graphics and somewhat badly recorded sounds.If this game would have been somewhat good, like texture based or audio based, with better jumpscares and better coop support so you don't have to reconnect after every second loading....Honestly, I would have not played it.This game has something. Something that I cannot explain. You can call it a charm or something. I really enjoyed the campaign (I am a liar, I quit right at the start because They told me there would be a jumpscare), but the coop.... Maaan the coop.Where should I start? The coop is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ It keeps disconnecting the one that is not hosting the game after every first/second loading, you cannot save, but only start from the chapters start, so you better not ragequit, it isn't much long, only 5 chapters and so on. I could talk days about the problems of this game, but I won't. I swear that I have never, ever in my life had so much......fun. Let me tell you how it all started.-Okay, we're in the game, two cops on a mission huh? Nice.-Meanwile my friend already has no ammo because he tried to shoot the door open.- Something runs at him screaming, he is yelling to my headphones like crazy (Meanwhile I am trying to reconnect because there was a loading)-Misses all his remaining bullets and kills it with his last few shots.-Meanwhile I connect, start shooting like a mad man to kill the second ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ coming at us.-We've got both of them.-Friend is almost dead, we continue down the street.-Inhuman scream-AN UPSIDE DOWN BED THAT HAS SOMEONE ATTACHED TO IT AND IS.....FLYING?! (10/10 has flying beds - IGN)-We both burst out laughing.-I find some ammo and a syringe-Try to give the syringe to friend, accidentally inject it myself. (10/10 would get high accidentally again - Me)-Somehow manage to get through it both alive (I died cuz a BIG ♥♥♥♥ING TREE punched me and I flew like 500000 metres [Not lying] across the whole ♥♥♥♥ing map and then he♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me vigourously, friend picked me up after)-Get to a house.-Search it whole.-Oh a stairwell.-What could possibly go wrong on a stairwell?-GUESS WHAT, EVERYTHING!-Friend tries to run up the stairs and the stairs broke down as he falls through them.-SO MANY INHUMAN SCREAMS (One of them my from my friend just because he got scared so hard)-Jump down after him so I can save him like a mother♥♥♥♥ing hero from his misery.-Survives just barely....Yeah, that's just how our first session went because I went to bed after that.Day 2-Skipped the first chapter and went straight to the second just because we did not want to went through it again.-Friend spawns in a apartment hall, I am still loading.-Stars screaming as something is running right at him and then explodes.-*I connect*-Help him defeat all these inhuman enemies.-He finds a shotgun and I find something like a bolt action rifle from ww2-Go up the stairs.-WTF IS THAT (screams my friends)-WTF IS WHAT (I scream)- Then I turn around and see a ♥♥♥♥ing SOMETHING running at us, but it doesn't have arms, IT JUST HAS TWO ♥♥♥♥ING CHAINSAWS.-Die like 15 times, almost at our peak of ragequitting, then finally kill him.-Nice, start searching the apartment.-Friend starts screaming like a girl again.-Ask him WTF Happened.-He described that he saw a m4a4 like weapon in a bathroom and when he ran up to it, that the floor broke and he fell down.-Cannot find him, tell him that I am scared.-Finally find ourselves.-Move on.-A ♥♥♥♥ing forrest?-Nah, I am good.That's just how our second session went. We had two more, but I dont want to write anymore.Okay, so overall, best game ever.No seriously, In the term of best COOP horror game, I would say that this one is the best.10 out of ♥♥♥♥ing 10 , would love to hear my friend and myself scream like a little girl again.

content:
Posted: November 1, 2015
												One thing that saddens me is the fact that most people who write the negative reviews either dont give the game a chance (playing for 0.3 hours and writing a negative review) or the just try and play the buggy co-op mode (not what you should try and play first when you get this). Anyway, just had to get that off my chest, now for the pros and cons!pros-Interesting storyline that slowly reveals itself-Lots of unlockables, challenges, custom campains,and multiple endings for replayibilty-Game doesn't make you feel like its a mod, more feels like it's its own game-Very realistic gunplay, like reloading too soon will waste bullets-A good variety of interesting, and/or scary monsters whith different ones getting intruduced as the game progress, keeping you on your feet.-Truly good jumpscares/scares, the game has a tendency to get you nice and comfortable and then BAM in your facecons-Kinda wierd learning curve, like some tutorials seem inconplete-Ammo saving melee can be very hard to do, and takes awhile to figure out the proper technique-Co-op campain seems a bit buggy, like randomly getting disconnected or being able to keep stun-locking enimies-Dated graphics, although kinda phenominal for using the old half life engie and still looking decent, pales in comparison to the graphics of other horror games misc-very hardcore kinda gameplay, this can be a bad thing for some people and a good thing for other people, so I didn't want to put this in pros or consSo if you like horror games, give this a try, afterall it is free. Just make sure to give the game a fair chance, once you understand how the mechanics work you'll love it.

												Reasons why this is one of the best indie horror games I've ever played:1.This is a Half Life 1 mod, but you can clearly tell that new elements had been carefully coded in, by a group of 6 people.2.This is not the typical Slender clone you'll usually see, it has a great plot and doesn't rely on thosands of jumpscares.3.This game is amazing at getting reactions out of you. Sometimes it had me in disbelief, other times it had me scared out of my mind.If you want an exceptional horror game with simple controls and a stellar storyline, but don't have a lot of cash, then I strongly reccommend giving Cry of Fear a try. That is, if you dare.

content:
Posted: November 11, 2014
												Cry of Fear is simply one of the best games I have ever played. I'll jump right into it.Gameplay:CoF (I'll refer to Cry of Fear as CoF from now on) has some of the most challenging and enjoyable gameplay that I've ever played. The game operates as an FPS, with a non-recharging health system, and a (very) slowly recharging stamina bar. It follows the SH2 method of saving which is scattered save points around the world, in the form of tape recorders. You also have an inventory system with limited space, with which you can carry around key items, weapons, and health. This forces the player to make critical decisions about what they leave and what they take. Do you drop your pistol, weak but with lots of ammo, or your shotgun, strong with only a few shots left? The player must also make use of a cell phone for their source of light, but the game allows you to hold your phone in one hand and the gun in the other, at the expense of reduced stability/accuracy. Most of the actual game follows a pattern reminiscent of HL and SH2. The long-term goal is to get back to your house, however, you get sidetracked by cryptic messages to your phone, blockages in the streets, and of course, monsters, among other things. Like HL, there will be a lot of backtracking, to the point where it can become frustrating. Sometimes the solution to your current puzzle won't be obvious, and you might have to go through some confusion before it becomes clear (possibly with the help of a walkthrough). Unlike HL or SH2, the game features an objective-based system, giving you a clear (but sometimes confusing) goal to work towards. There are puzzles and combat interwoven well throughout the entire game. The combat can be frantic, and until you get the rhythm of each enemy down, can be frustrating. The monsters you face will be, above all, difficult. They are fast, unexpected, loud and disturbing. Several times I found myself jumping even when I knew that there was a monster. They move in a way that is totally alien, creating a very strange and creepy atmosphere. Story:You're Simon, a 19 year old boy who awakens in an alley after being hit with a car. It appears that there's something wrong with this city. Who are these monsters who are attacking you? Why is everyone gone? Of course, I can't give anything away, but there are quite a few plot points that I didn't notice first time around, and quite a few spoilers. The story for me ranks up there with that of SH2. This game is scary and disturbing. The characters Simon encounters are provocative and make you question what's really happening inside the game. They are strong characters who, though you know little about them, have intruiging and different personalities, that make them feel like real human beings. They aren't over-the-top caricatures of people, but act in a human way, even if sometimes that means an incredibly ♥♥♥♥ed up human. Sound: The voice acting is pretty meh, to be honest. Throughout the game, it increases in quality. Specifically the latter half, it really starts to get good. The sound design otherwise is superb. I never felt safe at any section of the game. There's always a reason to be afraid to go through the door, to check corners, or behind you. I always felt on edge because of the uneasy and at times, disturbing soundtrack. The monsters themselves make really creepy noises, from unearthly howls to shallow breathing that seemed to get right in your ears. The sound does a good job of creating the atmosphere.Visuals: So graphics. This game isn't the prettiest game you'll ever see. It's not at an Amnesia level, but for a free game, it's pretty ♥♥♥♥ing nice. The textures aren't super grainy, the models are well done and fit in with the maps, and you can't beat the variety in environments. Presumably you're in Sweden, and you'll go through a variety of environments, including, but not limited to, sewers, apartments, streets, alleyways, offices, parks, rooftops, subarbs, a mental hospital, a lake house, and a forest. Each felt very different from the next, but flowed together very well. Animations are damn well done - 3d person cutscenes never felt awkward or out of place, and they look good for a (free) game built on an older engine. Overall:This is a terrifying game. This is a difficult game. This is a great game. I would urge everyone to give this game a try. Fans of other classics like SH will enjoy this. I was disturbed, and sufficiently spooked several times over. I would have paid 20 dollars for this. ♥♥♥♥, I probably would've payed like 30, or 40 dollars for this. This game is worth so much more than 0 dollars. Give it a try, just for an hour. Then give it another 8 hours. Then cry and♥♥♥♥♥♥yourself from the scares. 10/10 would be too scared to leave my room again

												The game has its flaws and plus sides so i will try to break it down to youPluses-Atmosphere- the game has its parts when it can get scaryJumpscares- they will scare you in the most unexpected parts of the gameEnemies- some enemies can be a threat to you. some of them are fast but slow some of them can trap you in the corrner and kill you some of them even can flyStory- Story is preety good Co-Op wise and in single-player it can be even better altough you can get stuck in some partsFlaws-Graphics- altough not as bad as it can be it looks like a bad texture half life 1 modSound- some of the sound that enemies makes is a bit overused loops and can get anoying Bugs- Some times the game may crash durning the game play and it gets realy anoyingFun parts- Reviving In Co-Op - Just play in coop and try to revive your team mate you will understand what i'am talking aboutGlitches- Some time the dead body of the enemie can get stuck in the ground and start glitching and streching out trough whole screen but there are many other funny glitches you can findBut thats just a bit of my review you have to play the game yourselfMy rating to the game is 7.9/10

content:
Posted: February 28, 2016
												At first this game may appear to be a steaming pile of♥♥♥♥♥♥ but upon further examination I found Cry of Fear to be a deeply nuanced and riveting experience.  I soon came to realize that this game represents the exploitation of the working class by the aristocratic bourgeoisie reptilian semites from Babylonian antiquity. The game mirrors the human endeavor to arise from the mundane and materialistic plane unto the divine and immortal sphere of the enlightened ones through multiple reincarnations. I came to understand the role of the modern emasculated man living in the Kali Yuga, to live as an ascetic warrior resisting the facade of the modern liberal monoculture. Thats why I showed Alexander Dugin this game and he said  it affected him profoundly. Whoever made this game should get a noble piece prize and I will personally blow him/her.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2013
												i remember playing this game every tiem i play it with family and friends they get all depressed but when i play it by myself i get emotionally, and mentally traumentized and when i beat it my best friend had to have been put in a refinement center. lol NO I'm joking for teh lulz. It has some nice puzzles, the efforts placed into the creation of the game is capital, and you could learn more about the development of the game via it's website or by unlocking the director's commentary. For example, ruMpel went around his neighborhood to get ideas on map/level design. This game has at least 4 endings, but I will not be a spoilering ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and tell you about all of them. However I think ALL of the endings aresaddening, because just this once I will be an inglorious ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, Simon the Main protagonist kills himself. If there are secret endings, I hope I can find them myself The combat system is nice, it forces YOU to choose what to use, IE: A baton, a shotgun, and finally a hunting rifle. That was just an example of one of the combat loadouts. Speaking of combat & gameplay, there is a multiplayer mode with it's own storyline where you and a team of polisen trying to find Simon. However, somehow, you share the same hellish relm with our crippled David Leatherhoff in a grey hoodie.I recommend this game to fans of the "Silent Hill" series, the "Resident Evil" series,"Left 4 Dead" series, and finally to everyone that has played, beaten, and enjoyed the half-life mod, "Afraid of Monsters".

content:
Posted: October 20, 2016
												How this game is free is beyond me. This game has many unlockables and easter eggs.Every boss and miniboss can be killed with a certain method.Not for the faint hearted has many jumpscares and other scary events.Though I am not a massive fan of many horror games this game incorporates many features seen in titles such as Jericho, silent hill, resident evil, and The darkness.A gem for being in the free section.Pros:Scary even with outdated graphics.Environment is carefully crafted watch for small details.Many weapons. Limited inventory space - con for meChallenging bosses and minibosses.Many monsters.Cosmetic unlockables.Even on easy its a challenge.Voice acting (not the best but still)Objects found enhance story.Scenes induce emotion and relate you to main character.Multiple endings based on your choices.Weapon style/stance options.Cons:Outdated graphics.Environment can kill you by both design or occasional bug.Limited space to me was a con.Have to conserve ammo.Dropped items sometimes disappear during inventory management.Some weapons are basically useless.Too many useless doors.Needs to automatically use keys if you have them.Ladders are often hazards.Despite my most constructive and agressive criticisms 10/10 a gem for many gamers.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 11, 2014
												Cry of Fear is simply one of the best games I have ever played. I'll jump right into it.Gameplay:CoF (I'll refer to Cry of Fear as CoF from now on) has some of the most challenging and enjoyable gameplay that I've ever played. The game operates as an FPS, with a non-recharging health system, and a (very) slowly recharging stamina bar. It follows the SH2 method of saving which is scattered save points around the world, in the form of tape recorders. You also have an inventory system with limited space, with which you can carry around key items, weapons, and health. This forces the player to make critical decisions about what they leave and what they take. Do you drop your pistol, weak but with lots of ammo, or your shotgun, strong with only a few shots left? The player must also make use of a cell phone for their source of light, but the game allows you to hold your phone in one hand and the gun in the other, at the expense of reduced stability/accuracy. Most of the actual game follows a pattern reminiscent of HL and SH2. The long-term goal is to get back to your house, however, you get sidetracked by cryptic messages to your phone, blockages in the streets, and of course, monsters, among other things. Like HL, there will be a lot of backtracking, to the point where it can become frustrating. Sometimes the solution to your current puzzle won't be obvious, and you might have to go through some confusion before it becomes clear (possibly with the help of a walkthrough). Unlike HL or SH2, the game features an objective-based system, giving you a clear (but sometimes confusing) goal to work towards. There are puzzles and combat interwoven well throughout the entire game. The combat can be frantic, and until you get the rhythm of each enemy down, can be frustrating. The monsters you face will be, above all, difficult. They are fast, unexpected, loud and disturbing. Several times I found myself jumping even when I knew that there was a monster. They move in a way that is totally alien, creating a very strange and creepy atmosphere. Story:You're Simon, a 19 year old boy who awakens in an alley after being hit with a car. It appears that there's something wrong with this city. Who are these monsters who are attacking you? Why is everyone gone? Of course, I can't give anything away, but there are quite a few plot points that I didn't notice first time around, and quite a few spoilers. The story for me ranks up there with that of SH2. This game is scary and disturbing. The characters Simon encounters are provocative and make you question what's really happening inside the game. They are strong characters who, though you know little about them, have intruiging and different personalities, that make them feel like real human beings. They aren't over-the-top caricatures of people, but act in a human way, even if sometimes that means an incredibly ♥♥♥♥ed up human. Sound: The voice acting is pretty meh, to be honest. Throughout the game, it increases in quality. Specifically the latter half, it really starts to get good. The sound design otherwise is superb. I never felt safe at any section of the game. There's always a reason to be afraid to go through the door, to check corners, or behind you. I always felt on edge because of the uneasy and at times, disturbing soundtrack. The monsters themselves make really creepy noises, from unearthly howls to shallow breathing that seemed to get right in your ears. The sound does a good job of creating the atmosphere.Visuals: So graphics. This game isn't the prettiest game you'll ever see. It's not at an Amnesia level, but for a free game, it's pretty ♥♥♥♥ing nice. The textures aren't super grainy, the models are well done and fit in with the maps, and you can't beat the variety in environments. Presumably you're in Sweden, and you'll go through a variety of environments, including, but not limited to, sewers, apartments, streets, alleyways, offices, parks, rooftops, subarbs, a mental hospital, a lake house, and a forest. Each felt very different from the next, but flowed together very well. Animations are damn well done - 3d person cutscenes never felt awkward or out of place, and they look good for a (free) game built on an older engine. Overall:This is a terrifying game. This is a difficult game. This is a great game. I would urge everyone to give this game a try. Fans of other classics like SH will enjoy this. I was disturbed, and sufficiently spooked several times over. I would have paid 20 dollars for this. ♥♥♥♥, I probably would've payed like 30, or 40 dollars for this. This game is worth so much more than 0 dollars. Give it a try, just for an hour. Then give it another 8 hours. Then cry and♥♥♥♥♥♥yourself from the scares. 10/10 would be too scared to leave my room again

content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
												This game abused and violated me.For the first half Cry of Fear played exactly like the Silent Hill-ish psychological horror game that I thought it would be.But then... everything changed when the second half attacked.Apparently the devs knew me in a previous life and they got reincarnated as Team Psykskallar in order to make a game that would hold me down and touch me inappropriately over and over again.Their game constantly defied my expectations and gamer logic.Enemies never show up where they "should". Ammo and health pickups never appear where they "should".You have limited inventory space and are constantly expected to make room for mandatory plot items.Do you like fuses? You are going to hate fuses like Pavlov's dog with rabies.Why, Team Psykskallar? WHY did I have to go back and get those fuses? And then another time?After I defeated the final boss my kitchen faucet exploded. I spent 20 minutes cleaning my kitchen, drenched in water, laughing like a maniac. 10/10

number of helpful: 6 of 12 people (50%) found this review helpful12 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
												>The moment when you don't get an S-Rank because your accuracy was 1% below the requirement.>The moment when you have to redo the doctor fight because some stupid shooter guy refuses to get frozen by camera.>The moment when you realize that you forgot to pick up your tape cassette and can't save.>The moment when a hammer guy sneaks up on you when you're checking your inventory.>The moment when you run out of glock ammo while fighting the Sawwer and have to use the Axe.>The moment when you get so frustrated trying to fight Sick Simon that you give up on ending 4.>The moment when you realize that you're S-Ranking this game for no reason.>The moment when you give up on Cry of Fear.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 26, 2013
												I always wanted to try Cry of Fear, I started to watch this project back in 2009 and I was really looking forward to it and now it's a fully standalone game (previously you needed Half-life 1 to play it, because it was just a modification).The game itself is amazing, I like it, but it's extremely funny; flying beds with zombies chained to them, zombies moving upside down - kicking you with their legs and those funny screams they have, I laughed so hard. It's supposed to be scary but it's too damn hillarious for me :D huge golems, falcon-punching you and when you're on the ground, they finish you with their legs. But the best moment was when we played co-op with my friends, one got too close to some doors and the upside down zombie kicked the doors and screamed, after that it almost killed me because I was unable to aim xD it has really awesome and memorable moments, but I don't want to spoil anything more.Ok, now the bad things: I want to mention the overpowered chainsaw dudes. They are fast, they kill you with one hit and if you don't have ammo, you're literally ♥♥♥♥ed. But it makes the atmosphere really intense, so maybe it isn't a negative thing. But they should make them to kill you with 2 hits, or they should be at least kinda slower. Also, the creatures are slightly bugged. Sometimes they go through walls or just don't attack you at all.But other than that, this game is great. Flawless if you play it in co-op with the right friends.Team Psyskallar did a really great job ;)Overall: 10/10

Posted: April 26, 2013
												I always wanted to try Cry of Fear, I started to watch this project back in 2009 and I was really looking forward to it and now it's a fully standalone game (previously you needed Half-life 1 to play it, because it was just a modification).The game itself is amazing, I like it, but it's extremely funny; flying beds with zombies chained to them, zombies moving upside down - kicking you with their legs and those funny screams they have, I laughed so hard. It's supposed to be scary but it's too damn hillarious for me :D huge golems, falcon-punching you and when you're on the ground, they finish you with their legs. But the best moment was when we played co-op with my friends, one got too close to some doors and the upside down zombie kicked the doors and screamed, after that it almost killed me because I was unable to aim xD it has really awesome and memorable moments, but I don't want to spoil anything more.Ok, now the bad things: I want to mention the overpowered chainsaw dudes. They are fast, they kill you with one hit and if you don't have ammo, you're literally ♥♥♥♥ed. But it makes the atmosphere really intense, so maybe it isn't a negative thing. But they should make them to kill you with 2 hits, or they should be at least kinda slower. Also, the creatures are slightly bugged. Sometimes they go through walls or just don't attack you at all.But other than that, this game is great. Flawless if you play it in co-op with the right friends.Team Psyskallar did a really great job ;)Overall: 10/10

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
You will♥♥♥♥♥♥yourself.This game is my number-one favorite indie horror game. From the atmosphere, to the gameplay, to the sheer psychological terror it dishes out, this game deserves every bit of praise it gets.Pros:  Psychological horror on par with Silent Hill and others.  Gameplay is very well-done; controls are tight and responsive, weapons are realistic, enemies are intelligent.  Always manages to keep you alert and scared, with dimly-lit alleyways, nearly-silent buildings, and things moving out of the corner of your eye.  Sound design is masterful; just as many scares come from the background noise as they do the monsters themselves.  Very good-looking, given the age of the engine it runs on.Cons:  Co-op mode is buggy, frequently refuses to connect; it's just a PvE deathmatch mode, anyway, and nowhere near the main focus, so it doesn't matter much.  Very dated engine, although the devs hid it well.Overall: 10/10, would♥♥♥♥♥♥my pants again.

												The game has its flaws and plus sides so i will try to break it down to youPluses-Atmosphere- the game has its parts when it can get scaryJumpscares- they will scare you in the most unexpected parts of the gameEnemies- some enemies can be a threat to you. some of them are fast but slow some of them can trap you in the corrner and kill you some of them even can flyStory- Story is preety good Co-Op wise and in single-player it can be even better altough you can get stuck in some partsFlaws-Graphics- altough not as bad as it can be it looks like a bad texture half life 1 modSound- some of the sound that enemies makes is a bit overused loops and can get anoying Bugs- Some times the game may crash durning the game play and it gets realy anoyingFun parts- Reviving In Co-Op - Just play in coop and try to revive your team mate you will understand what i'am talking aboutGlitches- Some time the dead body of the enemie can get stuck in the ground and start glitching and streching out trough whole screen but there are many other funny glitches you can findBut thats just a bit of my review you have to play the game yourselfMy rating to the game is 7.9/10

content:
Posted: February 28, 2016
												At first this game may appear to be a steaming pile of♥♥♥♥♥♥ but upon further examination I found Cry of Fear to be a deeply nuanced and riveting experience.  I soon came to realize that this game represents the exploitation of the working class by the aristocratic bourgeoisie reptilian semites from Babylonian antiquity. The game mirrors the human endeavor to arise from the mundane and materialistic plane unto the divine and immortal sphere of the enlightened ones through multiple reincarnations. I came to understand the role of the modern emasculated man living in the Kali Yuga, to live as an ascetic warrior resisting the facade of the modern liberal monoculture. Thats why I showed Alexander Dugin this game and he said  it affected him profoundly. Whoever made this game should get a noble piece prize and I will personally blow him/her.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2013
												i remember playing this game every tiem i play it with family and friends they get all depressed but when i play it by myself i get emotionally, and mentally traumentized and when i beat it my best friend had to have been put in a refinement center. lol NO I'm joking for teh lulz. It has some nice puzzles, the efforts placed into the creation of the game is capital, and you could learn more about the development of the game via it's website or by unlocking the director's commentary. For example, ruMpel went around his neighborhood to get ideas on map/level design. This game has at least 4 endings, but I will not be a spoilering ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and tell you about all of them. However I think ALL of the endings aresaddening, because just this once I will be an inglorious ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, Simon the Main protagonist kills himself. If there are secret endings, I hope I can find them myself The combat system is nice, it forces YOU to choose what to use, IE: A baton, a shotgun, and finally a hunting rifle. That was just an example of one of the combat loadouts. Speaking of combat & gameplay, there is a multiplayer mode with it's own storyline where you and a team of polisen trying to find Simon. However, somehow, you share the same hellish relm with our crippled David Leatherhoff in a grey hoodie.I recommend this game to fans of the "Silent Hill" series, the "Resident Evil" series,"Left 4 Dead" series, and finally to everyone that has played, beaten, and enjoyed the half-life mod, "Afraid of Monsters".

content:
Posted: March 7
												I'm a little late to the party here but if you're even later than me then DON'T GET THIS GAME. The story may be very good but there are loads of flaws not even the settings can fix. For one my view kept spiralling when I looked left or right so I could barely make it through the corridors in the first couple of minutes.For another the walking mechanics are as wobbly as they get. I get this game is not up-to-date by a long shot but for me it was a giant bug-/glitchfest from the start and I think we're not wrong to at least expect a somewhat decently built game. It was more buggy than your vision in SOMA.Maybe the storyline is worth a shot one day when I figure out what the hell to do to fix this hunk of glitches, but until then its a huge nono for me.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2015
												I don't know where to start with this game? Where do I start? You play as Simon, a depressed teenager who gets hit by a car and is in a wheelchair for the rest of his life. That is it. That is the game, a guy in a wheelchair writing a book and just play through what he writes in his book, alone in his room with the doctor coming in from time to time. But this thing, this man that you play as, Simon is just someone who wants to be loved, for someone  to care about him or he kills himself. Thats all he wants really and he thinks writing this book will him through that but in the real life, is that true? Can writing a book on things you see or do really change who you are, or want to be? No. No it can't there is no way that writing one book will help him or anyone for the matter. He would have to write more than just one book to tell his story... his... cry of fear

content:
Posted: November 10, 2014
												For a game built around the GoldSRC engine, this looks pretty amazing. The game itself is like an FPS Silent Hill, and plays pretty well! The 3D menu is a bit wonky, but works okay for the most part. And I love, I repeat, LOVE the music! The Co-op is fun too, if you can host it properly.And did I mention this game is free? Because it is. Why haven't you downloaded this game yet? You have nothing to lose!

content:
Posted: September 9, 2016
												Cry of Fear has got to be my favorite game by far. Terrifying atmosphere, awesome soundtrack, and great story. This game scared the ever loving crap out of me! And considering that this was a mod for the original Half-Life, the graphics were really good for being made on the engine it was. No matter how many times I've played this game, I can never get enough of it! Amazing game! Five stars! I would have payed $20 for it!

content:
Posted: April 18, 2014
												This game is single player survival horror based on the mind of 19 yr Simon Henriksson the main character you play as. The game begins where Simon is walking down the street and suddenly finds a man injured on the ground and rushes to his ade. When he asks the man what happend a car with no driver starts behind you and rams full speed in to you knocking out the main character. once waking up he must find his way and gather his bareings through a freakish world of his imagination and survive against all of his thought and feelings evolved to monsters and 3 boss battles! can you survive? find out and overcome Cry Of Fear! "The thing that gave me the first impression I was in deep♥♥♥♥♥♥was the warning of no small children, pregnant women, or elderly in the beginning of the story mode."-BlackOut

content:
Posted: January 23, 2016
												The graphics are♥♥♥♥♥♥Controls are♥♥♥♥♥♥The enemy itself is very stupid at times.Okay now that we've gotten the generic first look experiences out of the way, let's move on to why I'd bother with this one.It can at times legit scare you off your seat! (it has a few screamers and pretty sure not a good idea to play alone)Small and short levels that you can easily redo if you happen to suck and die at any given point. But I suppose that could be seen as a bad thing?Basically the only reason to play this game is if you're wanting to play it with a group of friends that can have a laugh with you because, trust me, this game will give you so many things to laugh about. The first three lines of this review, the ones that are supposedly thought of as 'cons' to a game are, for this game, one of the reasons why you should get it and enjoy it with your friends. Because, let's be honest, in this day and age everyone's playing freakin' games like Fallout 4, Arkham Knight, BO3 and all the good graphic demanding ones so it's always nice to chill out and go to the Feudal age a bit and that's when this here game comes into action!This one gets my lenny seal of approval!  ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

content:
Posted: April 18, 2014
												This game is single player survival horror based on the mind of 19 yr Simon Henriksson the main character you play as. The game begins where Simon is walking down the street and suddenly finds a man injured on the ground and rushes to his ade. When he asks the man what happend a car with no driver starts behind you and rams full speed in to you knocking out the main character. once waking up he must find his way and gather his bareings through a freakish world of his imagination and survive against all of his thought and feelings evolved to monsters and 3 boss battles! can you survive? find out and overcome Cry Of Fear! "The thing that gave me the first impression I was in deep♥♥♥♥♥♥was the warning of no small children, pregnant women, or elderly in the beginning of the story mode."-BlackOut

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												de hecho muy buen juego,jaja el single es muy bueno por la historia es mas los graficos son truchos,pero eso no importa lo q importa es la jugabilidad,de hecho un muy buen juego Survival Horror,segun yo supera a RE 4,estaria bueno q hagan un coop pero no el coop del cap 9 sino del cap 1 y de ahi toda la historia hasta el final eso estaria bueno... Dejen de leer para los q quieran hacer la historia porq les hare un pequeño spoilerSpoiler:En el comienzo del juego para los cagones :3 como yo,tengan cuidado a que X se acercan e.e ahi una en la q te acercas y te salta una cara por eso les aviso para q no tengan miedo xD y sepan q les va a pasar lel tambien les explico como va la historia de Simon y porq en el coop esta haci re sangrientoArmas:Bueno ni me atrevo pasar la historia por el tema del Jump Scream del comienzo,pero lo demas me chupa un huevo ni da miedo pero el jump scream si,bueno perdon me salte del tema de las armas jeje,no me atrevo a pasar la historia por el tema ese por eso no pude probar todas las armas del juego pero me se algunas unas cuantas pistolas,M4A1,Shotgun y mas de eso tambien rifle de sniperBueno aca termina mi analisis segun yo,buen juego de supervivencia horror,el q quiera jugar agregueme en steam(solo por hamachi se puede el COOP)Steam:Apunta con el cursor a mi foto -.-Skype:Emiliano.kihnFacebook:No me fiare de ust. a no ser q nos llevemos bien
